loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 34-year-old married man with two children. He has owned an espresso machine since 2006. Over the years, thanks to his business income, he has been able to meet his children's needs. Today, Mohamad is asking to borrow $1,000 to buy more merchandise to increase his income.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy four cows

loans.name: Jesus Is Lord Group

texts.en:
Jesus Is Lord Group is a group of five borrowers led by Tawa J..

Tawa is 32 years old and married with three children aged 2 to 15 years old with educational levels of 4th through 8th grade. She is illiterate due to poverty. She and her family lives on the Red Hill Field in Virginia, a newly built community for poor people who can't afford to buy a town lots. It is located north of Monrovia, the capital of Liberia.

Tawa's business is selling cigarettes, matches, peppermint candies, chewing gum, candles, biscuits (cookies), etc. She buys them wholesale and sells retail to residents on a table beside her home. She has been running this business for eight years. She sells good products and talks to customers with a good manner in order to encourage them to continue buying from her.

Tawa face difficulties during the rainy season because when it rains, no business goes on because she doesn't have shelter for her business. She needs this loan in order to purchase more goods to sell.

Tawa hopes to establish a shop in the future. She dreams of improving the living standard of herself and her family and building another house for them.

loans.use: To buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Julia Estela

texts.es: La señora Julia Estela Pérez A., tiene la edad de 45 años, habita en el barrio las conchitas ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe; ella es madre soltera, el apoyo que recibe es una de sus tres hija que es casada ya que tiene un negocio en el mercado oriental , la mayor dificultad que se le presento en estos últimos meses fue que le robaron casi todo la mercadería cuando fue de compras para surtir su pulpería el  cual dejo a cargo a su pequeña de 13 años en el negocio , lo cual fue una gran perdida y ha venido poco a poco incrementando. Agradece a Afodenic por la aprobación de su tercer crédito el cual lo va a invertir en la compra de granos básicos, golosinas, gaseosas, pan, lácteos para sastifaacer la demanda de sus clientes y poder dar un mejor servicio
texts.en:
Julia Estela Pérez A., 45, lives in the Las Conchitas neighborhood which is in the Ticuantepe township. She is a single mother. One of her daughers, who is married, helps her since she runs a small business in the Mercado Oriental (municipal market). The greatest misfortune she has had to face in the past few months is that almost all of her merchandise was stolen when she went to buy supplies for her small grocery store which she had left in the care of her 13-year-old daughter. This was a great loss and little by little she has been recovering. She is grateful to Afodenic for approving her third loan which will be used to buy basic grains, snacks, bread and dairy products to meet her customers' demands and provide better service.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grains, dairy product, snacks and bread.

loans.name: Camille

texts.fr: H. Camille est né le 19 Juillet 1965 et réside depuis une douzaine d'année au quartier Agla à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Camille est marié à ADJAÏ Anne-Marie, une ménagère. Le couple à trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Seul Camille assure les charges de la famille. Camille a arrêté les classes au secondaire. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de sa famille, Camille exerce depuis une vingtaine d'année le métier de calligraphie dans son quartier. En plus de cela, Camille mène comme activité secondaire, la teinte d'habits. Camille achète ses articles à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C'est un ancien client de ALIDé, ayant déjà bénéficié de deux crédits qui ont été bien remboursés. Pour renforcer davantage son activité, Camille sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Camille ambitionne créer un établissement de calligraphie.
texts.en:
Camille H. was born on July 19, 1965. For a dozen years, he's been living in the Agla neighborhood in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Camille is married to Anne-Marie ADJAÏ, a housewife. They have three school-attending children they have to support. Camille provides for the family alone. He dropped out of secondary school. To provide for himself and for his family, Camille has been a calligrapher in his neighborhood for about twenty years. In addition, he has a secondary business, dying clothes. He buys his supplies in Dantokpa, the international marketplace of Benin. He's already a client from Kiva's partner, Alidé, and has already benefited from two loans, which were repaid without problems. In order to further bolster his business, Camille is seeking a third loan from Alidé. He ambitions to open a calligraphy shop.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy dyes and fabrics

loans.name: Tserendorj

texts.en: Tserendorj is 31 years old and lives with his wife and 5-year-old son in Hovd province, one of Mongolia's western provinces. His son goes to a local kindergarten. Tserendorj has a small retail business with his wife. They sell meat at the local food marketplace called Han-Ord. Tserendorj usually purchases livestock, including sheep, cattle and goat, from herder families in the countryside and sells their meat in small pieces at the market. His wife usually sells the meat while he collects the livestock and prepares them for retail. They have been in the business since 2005 and their business capital has expanded from 300,000 MNT to 1,000,000 MNT ($1 = 1,450 MNT) to date. Tserendorj says that he would like to purchase livestock at this time of the year as meat prices hit the seasonal low and resell them in the spring when prices pick up. He requests a loan to purchase more livestock for his business. About XacBank XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save. To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team. To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here.

loans.use: To purchase more livestock

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila is married with a grown son. She runs a small business selling clothing merchandise in one of the local markets in Mukachevo. Ludmila has been in this trade for 4 years. Her business has proven to be very stable over these past years. Currently, Ludmila has 20,000 Grivnyas in inventory.

Ludmila has always believed family is her first and utmost priority in life. Her business has been a consistent source of support not only for herself but for her family as well. Ludmila is seeking a loan of 10,500 Grivnyas to increase assorted merchandise she offers for sale in her vending kiosk and grow her sales rates. We believe Ludmila’s persistence and determination will help her repay the current loan and succeed in business.

loans.use: to increase assorted merchandise

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena L., 35, wants nothing more than for her children to have a bright future. She is married to Orlando L., a factory worker, and they are blessed with one child who is studying in grade school. Rowena makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life. She has been managing her own variety store for three years.

Rowena joined the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) in 2008. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings* and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow eight times from CCT’s Cooperative. The reason why she was consistent in paying her dues was because she used all the money she borrowed as added capital for her store business. Her business now lets her earn a net profit of PHP 10,000 per month.

Now with your help, Rowena would like to apply for a PHP 18,000 loan. This amount will be used mostly as a source of added capital for her expanding business by buying sacks of rice, charcoal, soft drinks and other household commodities for her store.

Rowena dreams that her variety store will continue to grow and become a grocery so that they will have enough savings for the college education of their children.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise for her store

loans.name: Rosa Delia

texts.es:
El banco comunal Nueva Juventud está formado por un grupo de mujeres luchadoras  que  buscan con su esfuerzo salir adelante junto a sus familias, se han convertido en grandes amigas viven todas en la urbe cuencana, esta ciudad se caracteriza por su gente amable, sus paisajes, su centro histórico, en general es una ciudad encantadora que atrae al turista nacional y extranjero.

 Rosa E. vive en la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 37 años de edad se encuentra casada y ha procreado 7 hijos que se encuentran de 21, 19, 16, 15, 12, 10, 1 año de edad, su primera hija es casada  y vive en su casa compartiendo los gastos del hogar, su hijo de 19 vive con su abuelita en  la costa, el de 16 años  trabaja en   el mercado 9 de Octubre en Cuenca  vendiendo ropa aportando economicamente  aunque sea un poco, sus otros hijos de 15 y 12 aun son estudiantes de secundaria, su esposo trabaja eventualmente  como estibador (cargador) en una empresa  pero sólo cuando lo llaman y también realiza trabajos de soldadura ya que tiene el equipo necesario,  no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

Rosa se dedica al armado y retiro de casetas para la feria de los días miércoles, los días martes inicia sus actividades desde las 4 a.m.  hasta las 6 p.m., y para el retiro de las casetas empieza el  miércoles a  las 4 p.m. hasta las 12 a.m., lleva nueve años en esta actividad; hace siete meses inició  su negocio de cría de pollos y los comercializa en la feria libre que gracias a Dios le va muy bien.

Nuestra socia se encuentra en su segundo ciclo y se unió al banco comunal gracias a su  cuñada quien la invito a que forme parte del mismo,  nos comenta que  el primer crédito lo utilizó para montar su criadero de pollos, con el nuevo préstamo que reciba va a comprar más pollitos y alimento para su crianza para ir incrementando su negocio poco a poco.

Su sueño es llegar a comprarse un terreno para construirse una casa.
texts.en:
The loan group Nueva Juventud is made up of a group of energetic women who wish to get ahead in life with their families. They have become good friends. All of them live in the metropolis of Cuenca. This city is characterized by its friendly people, scenery and historic center. In general, it's a charming city that attracts domestic and foreign tourists.

Rosa E. lives in the metropolis of Cuenca. She is 37 years old, married and has 7 children who are 21, 19, 16, 15, 12, 10 and 1 year old. Her first daughter is married and lives with her, sharing household expenses. Her 19-year-old son lives with his grandmother on the coast. The 16-year-old son works in the 9 de Octubre market in Cuenca, selling clothes and contributing economically although his contribution is small. The 15-year-old and the 12-year-old are still in secondary school. Her husband works as a porter for a company, but only works when they call him. He also works as a wielder as he has the necessary equipment. They don't have their own house so they rent their home. Rosa works in the assembly and disassembly of stalls for the Wednesday market. On Tuesdays she works from 4am to 6pm. For disassembling the stalls, she works on Wednesdays from 4pm to 12am. She has been doing this for 9 years. Seven months ago she started her own business of raising chickens and she sells them at the market.

Rosa is in her second loan cycle. She joined the lending group thanks to her sister-in-law who invited her. She says that she used her first loan to start raising chickens. With the new loan she will buy more chickens and food to continue growing her business bit by bit.

Her dream is to be able to buy her own land to build a house.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Chong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a brood of chickens and feed

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en: Estrella A. is from the village of Panduma, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 53 years old, is married, and has one adult child. Estrella owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling different products such as bread, shampoo, coffee, cooking oil, vinegar, salt, sugar, candies and other items in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Estrella joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Estrella is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her fourth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Walter Antonio

texts.es: El Joven Walter O. tiene tres años de trabajar con CEPRODEL, ha tenido cinco créditos el cual ha demostrado ser una persona responsable, es soltero vive con sus padres y tres hermanos en la ciudad de Chinandega,  es empleado en la Alcaldía de Chinandega desempeñándose como auditor fiscal  en las diferentes empresas de este departamento, el crédito lo ocupara para cubrir gastos de la familia y para pagar matricula en la universidad ya que estudia Administración.
texts.en:
Walter O. has worked with CEPRODEL for three years. He has taken out five loans, which has shown him to be a responsible person. He is single and lives with his parents and three siblings in Chinandega. Mr. O. works in the Chinandega mayor's office as a fiscal auditor for the different programs within this office. His loan will be used to cover family expenses and university tuition for studying administration.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel McRoberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay university and household expenses

loans.name: María Cristina

texts.es:
La Sra. María Cristina V. H. es comerciante del municipio de Condega y se dedica a la fabricación y venta de pan.

Ella va a utilizar el crédito que solicita con nosotros para la compra de materia prima como es la haría, azúcar, etc. Con esto pretender ala ampliación de su negocio y por ende aumentar la oferta.

 Ella empezó haciendo pan en pequeñas cantidades y a medida que iba dando a conocer este producto iba aumentando la clientela hasta que su negocio creciera hasta como esta en la actualidad.

La Sra. María Cristina Comenzó  este negocio aproximadamente hace unos 15 años. Ella trabaja todos los días de lunes a sábado desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde, cabe señalar que esta señora siempre se ha dedicado a esta labor y le ayuda en las labores diarias la esposa del hijo.

Ella espera que con el financiamiento aumente su producción ara lograr cubrir su mercado casi en su totalidad.

La Sra. María Cristina V. es soltera y tiene 2 hijos en edad escolar a los que les costea sus gastos escolares.

Este es el crédito número diez que Doña María Cristina Solita en un periodo de siete años. Ella argumenta que estos financiamiento le han ayudado a sacar adelante dicho negocio con éxito ya que la situación a encarecido la materia prima, por lo que se muestra agradecida por los financiamiento que Ceprodel le ha hecho.
texts.en:
María Cristina V. H. is a merchant from the municipality of Condega and makes a living baking and selling bread. She plans to use the loan to purchase ingredients such as flour and sugar to expand her business. She started baking bread in small quantities and while she was getting to know the trade she was growing her clientele until her business grew to where it is today. María started the business approximately 15 years ago, and she works Monday through Saturday from 6 a.m. to 5 p.m. Her son's wife helps her with the work daily. She hopes that with the loan she can increase her production to cover nearly her entire market. María is single and has two children who are still in school, which she pays for. This is her 10th loan over a period of seven years, and the loans have helped her successfully make headway with the business since the ingredients can get expensive. She is grateful for the support Kiva partner Ceprodel has given her.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients (corn, flour, sugar, lard, etc.)

loans.name: Florida's Group

texts.en:
Florida S. is from the village of San Lorenzo, Ilagan, Isabela. She is 35 years old. Florida is the group leader of a 9-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 'Florida S.'.

Florida is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Florida owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for fattening and for sale. Florida has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Florida joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Florida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. Florida is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Florida from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future

loans.name: Margarida

texts.pt:
Margarida Paulo Macaringue nasceu no Distrito da Macie, Província de Gaza, sul de Moçambique tem 33 anos de idade casada e mãe de 3 filhos de 11,04 anos e um menor de dois anos de idade, o mais velho vai a escola. 

Tem 10ą classe feita, neste momento frequenta o ensino a distancia Naõ estudou porque os pais não tinham condições e abandonaram lhe ao cuidado dos avós. Vive na casa própria e não sustenta ninguém seus filhos já são maiores de idade. Trabalha de profesora ao mesmo tempo que estuda.

Este e o seu primeiro emprestimo con Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Margarida Paulo Macaringue was born in Macie District, Gaza Province, in Southern Mozambique. She is 33 years old, married, and the mother of three children 11, 4 and 2 years old. The eldest attends school. She completed 10th grade, and currently takes distance learning classes. She didn't study because her parents were without means and abandoned her to the care of her grandparents. She lives in her own house, she doesn't support anyone, her children are all grown up. She works as a teacher at the same time that she studies.

Translated from Portuguese by David Kaisel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: compra de material de construção (cimentos, chapas de zinco e outros)

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Danaya sont toutes mariées dans des familles polygames. Elles ont 40 ans,  4 enfants et habitent dans le village de Massala : Commune Rurale de Sakoïba   (4ème Région administrative du Mali). 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de mariage et de voisinage. 
Dans le souci d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, elles ont  décidé d’adhérer au programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. 
Elles sont à leur 1er  de prêt solidaire et font le commerce, de bois de chauffe, d’arachide et de céréales (mil et riz). 
Madame Assoumahou T. qui est la présidente du groupe fait le commerce d’arachide et compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 2 sacs de grains d’arachide dans la foire de N’Gassola et Téssérèla.  Elle revend son  arachide à domicile et à la foire de Ségou à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit. 
Comme toutes les autres femmes du groupe, Madame  Assoumahou T. espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour l’entretien des enfants et réinvestir dans leurs activités. 
Elles ont pour ambition d’aider leurs maris à assurer l’auto suffisance alimentaire dans leurs foyers respectifs.
texts.en:
The members of the Danaya group are all married and living in polygamous families. They average 40 years of age with four children and live in the village of Massala in the rural community of Sakoïba (fourth administrative region of Mali). They got to know each other through relatives, marriage and neighbors. As they want to expand their businesses, they decided to join Soro Yiriwaso's loan program. They are on their first group loan and trade in firewood, peanuts and cereals (millet and rice). Mrs. Assoumahou T., who is the president of the group, trades in peanuts and is planning on using her loan to buy two sacks of peanut grains at the fairs in N'Gassola and Téssérèla. She resells her peanuts at home and at the Ségou fair to a customer base made up of men and women, for cash and on credit. In common with all the other women in the group, Mrs. Assoumahou T. hopes to make an average monthly profit of 25,000FCFA, which will be used for the upkeep of the children and for reinvestment in their businesses. Their ambition is to be able to help their husbands to ensure self-sufficiency in terms of food in their respective households.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase peanuts

loans.name: Mazahua Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama MAZAHUA porque la comunidad en la cual habitan está muy arraigado el dialecto. Está ubicado en Atlacomulco, Estado de  México en un lugar donde las personas enfrentan diferentes  privaciones en su vida diaria; de las cuales salen avante con un gran compromiso y actitud.  El grupo está conformado por  10 integrantes. 
La tesorera del grupo se llama Rocío E. Cárdenas. Tiene 25 años estudió hasta la preparatoria, comenta que desafortunadamente no pudo seguir estudiando por la responsabilidad que adquiere en su casa y con su familia se dedica a la costura, no es casada y no tiene hijos, pero se ha tenido que hacer responsable de sus 9 hermanos en conjunto con su mama; día a día buscan la manera de solventar cada una de sus necesidades. Rocio se dedica a hacer manteles y servilletas que comercializa principalmente en, San Marcos Tlazalpan, Toluca, Distrito Federal, Santiago Acutzilapan y Atlacomulco, se inicio desde muy pequeña en el negocio sin pensar que fuera a ser esta actividad una fuente de ingreso, siempre le ha gustado la costura y lo aprendió de su mama aunque al principio menciona que le costó mucho trabajo aprender, su dedicación y perseverancia hizo posible que hoy en dia realice excelentes trabajos, ha enfrentado diferentes dificultades 	como lo ha sido que la vista se le ha debilitado pero afortunadamente su familia la apoya ayudándole a hacer sus trabajos. Al momento de solicitar el crédito está pensando en lo que va a comprar y siempre que tiene oportunidad visita los negocios de hilos para ir haciendo un presupuesto de lo que necesitara de dinero para comprar material. Rocio tiene la ilusión de que con su trabajo sus hermanos tengan mejores oportunidades en otros ámbitos de la sociedad y tengan una mejor calidad de vida que hoy en dia.

Los otros integrantes del grupo son:
Felipa N. M. (vta. plástico), 
Graciela V. Martínez (vta. Productos de lamina), 
Catalina Cárdenas Cárdenas (vta. De plástico y lamina), 
Cristina R. Cárdenas (vta. de verdura y artesanía), 
Ana Rosa Méndez N. (Vta. de plástico), 
Diana M. N. (vta. de plástico), 
Lucia Ramírez Sánchez (abarrotes), 
Luisa N. M. ( Taller de lamina), 
Mahe Adriana Hernández M. ( Taller de Lamina).
texts.en:
This group is called “Mazahua” because the community in which they live is deeply rooted in the dialect of the same name. They live in Atlacomulco, in the State of Mexico, where the people press forward with great commitment and attitude despite facing various hardships in their daily lives. The group consists of ten members.

The group treasurer is Rocío E. Cárdenas. She is 25 years old and studied through high school. Unfortunately, she says she had to quit school because of growing responsibilities at home and having to support her family by sewing. She is single and does not have children, but she is responsible for taking care of her nine siblings together with her mother. Every day she looks for ways to meet their needs. She makes tablecloths and napkins that are mainly sold in San Marcos Tlazalpan, Toluca, Mexico City, Santiago Acutzilapan, and Atlacomulco. Rocio learned how to sew at a young age without realizing that one day this skill would become a source of income. She always enjoyed sewing and was taught by her mother. Even though she had a hard time learning how to sew at first, Rocio’s dedication and perseverance resulted in the excellent work she produces today. She faces many challenges as a result of her weakened eyesight, but fortunately her family helps her with her other jobs. Upon requesting this loan, Rocio thought about what she would be buy and had always wanted to start a business making linens, so she will use the money to acquire the necessary materials. She hopes that though her work, her siblings will find better opportunities in other areas of society and experience a better quality of life today.

The other group members are: Felipa N. M. – sells plastics Graciela V. Martínez - sells metal cookware products Catalina Cárdenas Cárdenas - sells plastics and metal cookware Cristina R. Cárdenas - sells vegetables and handicrafts Ana Rosa Méndez N. – sells plastics Diana M. N. - sells plastics Lucia Ramírez Sánchez – sells groceries Luisa N. M. – operates a metal workshop Mahe Adriana Hernández M. - operates a metal workshop

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for making linens

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To operate businesses

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa M. is currently in the business of selling clothes and bed sheets at the market and is requesting a loan so she can stock pairs of shoes to sell. Hawa is 40 years old and is married with a husband who is a policeman. She has five children who all go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to establish a shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy pairs of shoes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy timber and other essential materials for his shop

loans.name: Allen

texts.en:
Allen is 28 years old and is married with two children: her first one is 5 years old and her last one is 2 years old. Allen’s husband does not have a job, so Allen has to work hard in order to help her family’s various situations in life.

Allen is now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her general store business through purchasing more products. This will allow her to earn more profits. With the extra money, she will be able to save money for the future.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es: La señora Gladis, tiene 61 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos, los cuales ambas son ya mayores de edad y le ayudan con aportes económicos. La señora Gladis se dedica a la elaboración de nacatamales, además de esto en su casa vende leña, frijoles, hielo, refrescos todo esto lo vende de contado. Ella tiene ya más de cinco años de tener ese negocio, el cual dio inicio con el propósito de tener una fuente de ingreso segura, para mantenerse ella y su familia. El trabajo duro siempre lo aprendió de su mama, la cual le enseño a elaborar nacatamales y la mandaba a vender a la calle a ella y a sus hermanas, pues fue así que aprendió a ganarse el pan de cada día. Ella solicito este crédito con el propósito de invertirlo en el negocio para seguir trabajando, y así obtener mayores ingresos económicos. Su sueño es seguir trabajando y que Dios le brinde la salud necesaria para continuar trabajando en su negocio.
texts.en:
Gladis is 61 years old, married, and has 2 adult children who help her economically. Gladis makes nacatamales (a special type of large tamale often sold in Nicaragua), and in addition she sells firewood, beans, ice and soft drinks from her home, all on a cash basis. She has had this business for more than 5 years. Her goal in starting the business was to have a secure source of income to support herself and her family. She learned to always work hard from her mother, who taught her to make nacatamales and sent her and her sisters out into the street to sell. In this way, she learned how to support herself. She requests a loan to invest in her business so that she can continue to work and obtain better earnings. Her dream is to continue to work, that God provides her with good health so that she can continue to work in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana Q. V., tiene la edad de 36 años, es casada y vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos,  que son su mayor prioridad. Ella  quiere comprar materiales para la fabricación de ropas y luego vender. Además en su taller de costura quiere ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor variedad de prendas de vestir. Tiene varios años que se dedica a la costura y quiere crecer ya que cuenta con muchos clientes que le permitirán crecer en su actividad. Es la  primera vez que recibe un préstamo de FUDECOSUR. Doña Ana desea tener mayores ingresos para invertir y darle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. FUDECOSUR le está brindando esta oportunidad  con mayores facilidades y la tasa de interés es mucho más baja,  también tiene el deseo de brindarles a sus hijos la educación necesaria  para que sean en el futuro  personas preparadas y puedan enfrentar de manera más fácil la vida.
texts.en:
Ana Q. V. is 36 years old, married, and lives with her husband and two children who are her highest priority. She wants to buy materials so that she can make clothing to sell. In addition to managing her sewing workshop, she wants to offer her customers with a wider variety of garments. Ana has been sewing for several years and has accumulated many customers, thereby allowing her to grow her business.

This is the first loan she has received from FUDECOSUR. Doña Ana wants to have more income to invest so that she can provide her children with a better quality of life. FUDECOSUR is providing this opportunity with greater convenience and a much lower interest rate. Ana also wants to provide her children with the necessary education that will help them become prepared individuals in the future who can deal with life more easily.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sewing materials

loans.name: Affa

texts.en:
Affa J. is currently in the business of selling bags of charcoal and firewood at her home. She is requesting a loan to stock bags of maize flour and beans to sell.  

Affa is 31 years old and married to a peasant. She has two children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a house for rent.

loans.use: Stock bags of maize flour and beans to sell

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en: To make a living, Lucia S. runs a sari-sari (variety retail shop) selling both food and daily use products in her community. She is 42 years old, married and has six grown-up children. She is from the village of Pandan, Gingoog City. Lucia is just starting this business. In 2009, Lucia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Lucia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Lucia is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This will be her fourth loan from HSPFI. She plans to use additional revenue to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Norma

texts.es: Norma de 30 años, vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos en su casa propia, ubicada en el pueblo de Llanco. Hace ya 8 años que alquila un pequeño terreno en el pueblo de Shiusha, donde siembra papa y arveja; sin embargo su mayor deseo es comprar su propio terreno para poder tener mayor capital e invertir en la compra de más semillas; por ello en los últimos años esta ahorrando para alcanzar su objetivo, por lo que esta por alcanzar su objetivo. Norma está sembrando mayor cantidad de arveja y espera que en esta oportunidad pueda obtener mayor ganancia, ya que en estos meses hay mucha demanda. Es el primer crédito con MFP y esta feliz de trabajar en un banco comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará semillas y abono para la cosecha de arveja que esta cultivando.
texts.en:
Norma is 30 years old and lives with her husband and four children is her own house located in the town of Llanco. She has been renting a small piece of land in the town of Shiusha for eight years where she grows potatoes and peas. However, her greatest wish is to buy her own land to be able to have more capital and invest in the purchase of more seeds. She has been saving over the past few years to be able to achieve her goal and she is almost there. Norma is planting a greater quantity of peas and hopes that she can obtain a higher income because there is a lot of demand in these months.

This is Norma’s first loan with MFP and she is happy to work in a communal bank. With the loan requested, she will purchase seeds and manure for the peas that she is growing.

loans.use: To purchase pea seeds and manure.

loans.name: Everlyn

texts.en:
Everlyn is 32 years old and single.  She sells second-hand shoes and clothes to earn a living.  She also does farming to earn extra income.  She hopes to succeed in her business and build her own house in the future.  

Since Everlyn joined Faulu Kenya, she has learned business techniques which have helped her in running her business.  She sees herself opening more outlets for selling second-hand clothes in the future.  She has requested for 20, 000 Kes to buy shoes and ladies handbags.

loans.use: To buy shoes and ladies handbags

loans.name: Mwanamvua

texts.en:
Mwanamvua S. is a thirty-nine year old food vendor in Mtongwe, Mombasa. She is married to Mohamed S., who supports her income, and they are blessed with two children. She has been in this business for the last three years and her income is great. 

Mwanambua has now applied for her second loan in KADET and she wants to purchase dry food stock like wheat flour, beans, and cooking fat for her business. She will use the anticipated profit to expand her business. 

She hopes that in future she will own residential houses for rental, and succeed in life.

loans.use: To purchase dry food stock like wheat flour, beans, and cooking fat for her business.

loans.name: Calmelita

texts.en:
Calmelita G. is a married woman who lives in Purok Tugas, Brgy. Ocoy, Sta. Fe, Cebu. She earns her living by operating a fish vending  business.   Her husband Antonio Ilustrisimo, who is 49 years old, helps in his wife's business activities.They have 6 children who are 18 to 46 years old with 4 of them having their own family.  

Calmelita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 17 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Calmelita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. 

Her previous loan of PHP 27,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 9,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 18th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 29,000 which she intends to use as additional working capital so that she could continue to save up for the future and become financially stable. 

Calmelita G. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Omar

texts.fr: Monsieur Omar D. est âgé de 35 ans. Il habite dans la localité de Yoff. Il est marié et père de 2 enfants dont l’âge varie entre 2 et 4 ans. Monsieur  D. exerce depuis plus de 10 ans la vente d’habits pour hommes. Dans les années 1990 il a pratiqué l’activité de tailleur. Actuellement en plus de son commerce d’habits il s’adonne périodiquement à la vente de céréales comme le mil, le blé, une fois dans la saison. Il a choisi l’activité de vente d’habits par passion et sur proposition de ses parents. Son but est de réaliser des bénéfices et gagner sa vie. Il est membre de la caisse de Yoff depuis octobre 2007. Il sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de céréales en vue de renouveler son commerce saisonnier. Son objectif est d’accroitre ses revenus et améliorer la situation de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Omar D. is 35 years old and lives in Yoff. He is married and the father of two children between 2 and 4 years old. Mr. D. has been selling men's clothing for more than ten years. In the 1990s he worked as a tailor. Currently, in addition to his clothing business, he periodically (once each season) sells cereals such as millet and wheat.

He chose the clothing business because of his passion for it and also because his parents proposed it. His goal is to make a profit and earn his living. 

He has been a member of the Yoff branch of UIMCEC since October 2007. He is seeking a loan of 500,000 francs to be used to buy cereals in order to renew his seasonal commerce. His objective is to increase his income and better his family's situation.

loans.use: Purchase of cereals

loans.name: Dina Argelia

texts.es:
La señora Dina, es emprendedora y laboriosa, tiene 67 años D. edad, posee una ferretería, resiD. en San Francisco Gotera,  departamento D. Morazán, donD. vive con su hijo llamado  Anner D. 29 años D. edad, este negocio lo atienD. en su casa D. habitación durante la semana y el domingo se traslada al mercado municipal, donD. ofrece los artículos.
Ella quiere invertir al negocio, comprando clavos, niveles, sierras, entre otras herramientas, pero su inconveniente es que no tiene los fondos para realizar la compra por lo que solicita un préstamo, y a través D. este conseguir la mercadería para fortalecer el negocio,  contando con variedad para una mejor atención a los clientes.
Su objetivo es que su negocio crezca, progrese y le D. ingresos estables por un largo tiempo.
texts.en:
Dina is an enterprising and hard-working woman.  She is 67 years old and owns a hardware store.  She lives in San Francisco Gotera, in Morazán department, together with her son Anner who is 29 years old.  Dina locates her business in her own home during the week and on Sundays she moves it to the town market where she sells her products.

Dina would like to invest in her business, buying nails, spirit levels, saws and other tools.  The problem she has is that she doesn't have enough funds to make these purchases.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan which she will use to acquire the merchandise.  This will strengthen her business as she will have a greater variety of products with which she can better serve her customers.

Dina's goal is to grow her business, to make progress in her business and for her business to proviD. her with a stable income for a long time.

loans.use: To buy nails, spirit levels, saws and other tools

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
La señora Mercedes López Benitez es comerciante, tiene su negocio sobre la avenida Ayolas, tiene un negocio muy bien surtido. Tiene muchísimos clientes porque tiene muy buena ubicación, trabaja desde hace 2 años en su negocio.
Es una señora  sacrificada y  luchadora, es madre soltera siempre soñó con tener su negocio propio para poder educar a su hija y mantener la casa .Con el préstamo obtenido ha comprado mas arroz, harina, aceites, lácteos, bebidas y así poder brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
Agradece mucho a la Institución por haberle brindado la oportunidad de sacar adelante su negocio por medio del crédito ya que pudo comprar mercaderia para el negocio como fideos, panificados, arroz y otros.
texts.en:
Mercedes López Benitez is a merchant.  She has a very well stocked store on Ayolas Avenue.  She has a lot of customers because she has a very good location.  She has been working in her business for two years.  She is a selfless and tenacious woman.  She is a single mother, and she has always dreamed of having her own business in order to raise her daughter and maintain the house.

With the loan she got she bought more rice, flour, oil, dairy products, and drinks.  She did this to be able to provide her customers with better service.

She is very grateful to the institution for having provided the opportunity to get ahead in her business via the loan.  She was able to buy merchandise like noodles, baked goods, rice, and other products for her business.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, noodles, baked goods, and other products

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita Y. is from the town of Plaridel. She is 55 years old. Carmelita is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Carmelita owns and operates a business venture raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. Carmelita has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Carmelita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carmelita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Carmelita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 12th loan taken out by Carmelita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Déthié

texts.fr: Madame Déthié T. habite  dans l localité de Camberene. Elle s’active dans le commerce  depuis plus de 25 ans. Elle est installée dans le marché depuis 7 ans ou elle  exerce la vente de tissus qui est sa principale activité. Elle est sociétaire au sein du guichet de Camberene  depuis aout 2001. Elle sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs qui sera destiné à l’achat de tissus ce qui lui donnera l’opportunité d’élargir son activité. Ce financement lui permettra d’accroitre ses revenus et d’améliorer sa situation sociale.
texts.en: Mrs. Déthié T. lives in the village of Camberene. She has been an active trader for more than 25 years. She set herself up in the market seven years ago and her main activity is the sale of  fabrics there. She has been a member of the Camberene branch since August 2001. She is requesting a loan of 500,000 francs which will be used to buy fabric and will give her the opportunity to expand her business. This loan will allow her to increase her income and improve her social situation.

loans.use: Increase of funds

loans.name: Ángel Enrique

texts.es:
En el municipio de Granada, Departamento de Granada, labora el señor Ángel Enrique T. V., el cual tiene 17 años de laborar como Operador de Equipo en una empresa ubicada en la misma zona. Es acompañado solo depende tres personas del cual está compuesto su núcleo familiar.

Este señor en estos momentos quiere realizar unos pagos personales y por eso visita a CEPRODEL para solicitar un crédito y de esta forma estar solvente y así poder darle a sus hijos un buen nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Mr. Ángel Enrique T. V. has been working as an Equipment Operator for a firm located in the town of Granada, Granada department for 17 years.  He has three dependents that make up his nuclear family.

He needs to make some personal payments so visits CEPRODEL’s offices to request a loan in order to be solvent and provide his children with a good living standard.

loans.use: For personal expenses.

loans.name: Missael

texts.en:
Missael B. is from the village of Barangay 26, Gingoog City. She is 34 years old. Missael is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Missael owns & operates recycling services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from hauling and selling plastics & other recyclables for local businesses and community members. She also buys and sells coconuts for copra. Missael has been engaged in her businesses for over 5 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Missael joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Missael has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Missael is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional plastics & other recyclables to sell. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Missael from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional plastics & other recyclables to sell

loans.name: Rosemary Ekua

texts.en: Rosemary Ekua A. sells cosmetics at Korfofordo near Jukwa in Cape Coast, carrying her wares from one area to another. She has been engaged in this business for about 10 years. Rosemary is divorced with four children and is the sole breadwinner of the home. She has a senior high school educational background. The funds from this loan will be added to her existing income in order to buy more cosmetics to offer for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Rosemary plans eventually to build a cosmetics shop.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics to offer for sale

loans.name: Martine

texts.en:
Martine is 50 years old and now lives in the Sémé-Podji district with her husband Gabriel and their six children. Three of their children are still in their care. All of their children are schooled.

For the past 20 years, Martine has sold food from her stall outside her home. This is her second loan with ALIDE following successful first repayment. It will allow her to purchase stock in bulk from Tokpa, Benin's largest market. Her aim is to improve her credit eligibility.

loans.use: to purchase various foods & condiments to sell in her stall

loans.name: Gloria Roxana

texts.es:
La señora Gloria Roxana es socia del banco comunal Nuevas Amigas del Distrito de Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 45 años de edad. Su esposo es trabajador independiente y tiene 4 hijos.
Lleva 3 años trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos. Gloria se dedica a la venta de alimentos, golosinas diversas y snacks en una escuela conocida de la cuidad, ha alquilado un kiosko para poder ofrecer sus productos, aprovechando la época escolar trabajará de lunes a viernes todo el día.  Debido a la gran demanda tiene dos personas que le ayudan.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 2,500.00 nuevos soles comprará: 2 cajas de galletas, 3 bolsas de caramelos, 5 tiras de chupetines, 2 cajitas de chocolate, 1 bolsa de chiche, 1 caja de fruna,2 bolsas de tofe, 3 tiras de chizitos, 3 tiras de chis tris, 3 tiras de papitas ley, 2 paquetes de gaseosas, 2 paquetes de agua. 1 caja de néctar,platos descartables, cucharas descartables,servilletas.
Este es un nuevo reto que se puso en su vida, quiere seguir trabajando para ayudar a su esposo y prepararse para su vejez, con Manuela Ramos tiene oportunidades para poder crecer más en su negocio y por eso está muy agradecida.
texts.en:
Gloria Roxana is a member of the "Nuevas Amigas" ["New Friends"] communal bank, of the District of Calleria, Department of Ucayali. She is 45 years old. Her husband is an independent worker, and she has 4 children. 

She has worked with loans from Manuela Ramos for 3 years. Gloria's business is selling food and various sweets and snacks at a well-known school in the city. She has rented a kiosk so that she can sell her products; during the school year she works from Monday to Friday, all day. Due to the great demand, she has two people who help her. 

With her new loan of 2,500 Peruvian new soles, she will buy: 2 cases of cookies, 3 bags of candies, 5 strips of lollipops, 2 wholesale boxes of chocolate, 1 bag of chick pea snacks, 1 case of Fruna [fruit candies], 2 bags of toffee, 3 units of Chizitos cheese puffs, 3 units of Cheese Tris cheese puffs, 3 units of Lays potato chips, 2 cases of soft drinks, 2 cases of water, 1 case of juice, and disposable plates, spoons and napkins. 

This is a new challenge she has set for herself in life; she wants to keep working so she can help her husband and prepare for her old age. With Manuela Ramos, she has opportunities so that she can grow more with her business, and she is very grateful for this.

loans.use: to buy various snacks, disposable serving items, etc.

loans.name: Peoung

texts.en: Peoung P., age 49, is married and resides in Siem Reap province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkorean Temples.  P. is a recycler, earning an income of about 10 USD per day.  Her husband is a road worker, earning an income of 4 USD per day.  Each month, the family has to spend 75 USD on food and 55 USD on other necessary expenses.  P. is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD to purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to work.  This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her children to commute to work

loans.name: Jyldyz's Group

texts.en:
Jyldyz K. is the leader of this group. She is 45 and married to a firefighter. Together with her husband she is bringing up three sons and two daughters. The older children study at university and the others are at school. 

Three years ago Jyldyz got a loan and purchased livestock. She made some profit reselling farm animals at a higher price after fattening them. She repaid the loan successfully and since that moment, she has been engaged in livestock breeding. 

With money received from the loan, Jyldyz wants to purchase more livestock for breeding. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line: people (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.es:
Candelaria es socia del  Banco Comunal “Nuevo Amanecer”, ubicado en el distrito Juli, provincia Chucuito, departamento de Puno, tiene 42 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene cuatro hijos (1 independiente), la señora estudio  hasta 1ro de educación secundaria.
Candelaria trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace cinco años,  su  préstamo inicial de  S/. 300.00 nuevos soles lo invirtió en su negocio de venta de artesanías, como bordados.
Con este nuevo préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevo soles, comprará dos kilos de lana matizados de diferentes colores y otros insumos para la elaboración de sus tejidos.  Trabaja sola en el negocio.
Su sueño es tener su propia tienda de artesanía y mejorar sus ingresos.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es  la facilidad del préstamo y lo que ganan sus ahorros.
texts.en:
Candelaria is a member of the communal bank "Nuevo Amanecer" (new dawn), located in the district of Juli, province of Chucuito, department of Puno. She is 42 years old, single and the mother of four children (one lives on his own). She studied up to first grade in secondary education.

Candelaria has worked for five years with the microfinance institution Movimiento Manuela Ramos. Her initial loan amounted to 300 new soles, which she invested in her handicraft (such as embroidery) business. She will use this new loan of 500 new soles to buy 2 kilograms of blended wool of different colors and other material to produce knitted fabric. She works alone in her business. Her dream is to have her own handicraft store and increase her income.

What she likes about her communal bank is the ease of the loan granting process and the possibility to save money.

loans.use: to buy 2 kilograms of blended wool of different colors.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is 52 years old, married and has three children, one of whom is in school. She works very hard to provide for her family by running a sari-sari (or variety) store in the Philippines and has applied for a loan for PHP 14,000 loan to buy more items to sell to her customers. She has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, biscuits and other groceries. In the future, Rebecca would like to save enough money to expand her business and provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 11 years.  She is 45 years-old, married to David and they have four school going children.  

She was introduced to Kiva partner KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be her second loan.  She paid for her previous loan of KES. 30,000 well and in good time.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy potato seeds, fertilizer, spraying chemicals and also to pay her casual workers.

In the future, Mary hopes to become a leading farmer in Ndunyu Njeru town.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, spraying chemicals and to pay for labour.

loans.name: Luis Elis

texts.es: Este cliente labora en una fábrica productora de cemento desempeñándose como facilitador de servicios generales, tiene diez   años  de trabajar para esta institución tiene dos hijos en edad escolar es casado. Es el crédito numero dos que solicita para mejorar un pequeño negocio de ventas de granos el cual es administrado por la esposa para tener otros ingresos en la unidad familiar.
texts.en: This borrower has been working for a cement factory as general services instructor for ten years. He is married and has two children who go to school. This is his second loan, and he will use it improve a small grains selling activity which his wife runs to get another income for the family.

loans.use: To buy products to improve his wife's grains selling activity.

loans.name: Aram

texts.en:
Aram was born in 1972 and he lives in Ijevan city. He is married and has a son and two daughters. 

Since 2000, Aram has been engaged in the shoe trading business in a rented place in the Ijevan city market center. At the same time, Aram and his father make shoes to order and per month, they produce approximately 60 pairs of shoes. 

Thanks to his business profit, Aram was able to repair his apartment. 

Aram has taken nine loans from Nor Horizon and one from Kiva, and he has never been delinquent in his repayments.

Aram asks for a loan of 500,000 AMD to buy summer shoes and sandals to resell and materials for his shoe production as well.

loans.use: To buy summer shoes and sandals to resell and materials for his shoe production as well.

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Samwel is a resident, businessman and a farmer in Eldoret town, North Rift, Kenya. His farm produces milk, maize and vegetables. He also trades in poultry in the local market. He is married and has four children between 16 and 5 years old.

Samwel has requested a loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a motorcycle for a transport venture. He says the venture will increase his income and enable him educate his children as well as offer security for his farming business. He aspires to have a fleet of motorcycles for the business.

Samwel says that the farming business is challenging because of the fluctuations in market prices for farm produce.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: El Triunfo Group

texts.es: La señora Vanessa quien pertenece al ALCOM EL TRIUNFO, es natural D. Carabayllo tiene 25 años y es conviviente, tiene 02 hijos uno D. 07 años y el otro D. 10 meses, se dedica a la venta D. productos D. belleza. Empezo poco a poco, al inicio era ayudante D. ventas y cuando ya tuvo sus clientes fijos se inscribio directamente, con este negocio a logrado apoyar a su pareja y tambien a ido creciendo sus ventas. Su deseo es poder tener una tienda granD. en donD. pueda vender todos sus productos D. belleza. El prestamo lo utilizara para la compra D. mas productos D. belleza.
texts.en: Vanessa, who is a member of the El Triunfo Group, is a native of Carabayllo, is 25 years old, and has a live-partner.  She has two children who are 7 years old and 10 months old, and works selling beauty products.  She began little by little and at the beginning, she was a sales assistant.  However, once she had regular customers, she registered herself.  With this business, she has been able to support her partner and she has also been increasing sales.  She wants to be able to have a large store where she can sell all of her beauty products.  She will use the loan for the purchase of more beauty products.

loans.use: to buy beauty products.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN NATIVIDAD”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maria; ella tiene 54 años de edad y es casada y tiene 6 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de verduras y también se dedica al negocio de crianza de animales como gallinas, chanchos y cuyes, la socia vende las verduras en el mercado y también lleva animales los fines de semana al distrito de Chinchero, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de animales y también ampliar el negocio de venta de verduras. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar verduras y también para comprar gallinas, chanchos y cuyes al por mayor y también para comprar semillas de espinaca y fertilizantes para las tierras de cultivo.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “Virgin Natividad” communal bank located in the district of Urubamba, in the province of Urubamba in the department of Cusco.

The member is Maria. She is 54 years old, married and has 6 children. She alternates her daily activities with the business of selling vegetables and she also has a business of raising animals such as chickens, pigs and guinea pigs. She sells the vegetables in the market and also brings her animals to the district of Chinchero on the weekends. She wishes to expand and improve her animal business and also expand her vegetable-selling business. She is requesting the loan to buy vegetables and also to buy chickens, pigs and guinea pigs whole sale as well as to buy spinach seeds and fertilizers for her fields.

She is happy for the loan and promises to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and also to buy chickens, pigs and guinea pigs whole sale as well as to buy spinach seeds and fertilizers for her fields.

loans.name: Maria Yamileth

texts.es:
María, se dedica a la venta de tortillas, vive con su suegra, dos hijos de 7 y 1 año de edad y su esposo, María lleva 5 años trabajando en la venta de tortillas y lo aprendió de su madre.
Actualmente necesita un préstamo para la compra de maíz, ya que desea comprar por mayor cantidad y obtener un mejor precio, con esta compra tendrá materia prima para un buen tiempo.
La intensión de ella es tener material para preparar las tortillas, aumentando sus ventas y con la esperanza de mejorar también la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Maria sells tortillas for a living. She lives with her mother-in-law, her two children aged 7 and 1 and her husband. Maria has spent 5 years selling tortillas, something which she learnt from her mother.

At the moment she needs a loan to buy corn as she would like to buy bigger quantities and get a better price. This purchase would mean she will have supplies for a long time.

Her intention is to have the ingredients to make tortillas and to increase her sales, in the hope of also improving her family's quality of life.

loans.use: To buy corn for her business.

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN BARTOLOME DE TAMBO REAL”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Susana; ella tiene 52 años de edad y es casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de agricultura, ella también se dedica al negocio de venta de leche, ella vende las 6:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, al socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de leche y negocio de agricultura. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar leche y semillas para las tierras de cultivo. 

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Susana is a member of the 'San Bartolomé de Tambo Real' community bank which is located in Anta district, in Anta province, in Cusco department.

Susana is 52 years old, married, and has four children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her farming business.  She also sells milk.  She makes her sales between 6.00am and 7.00pm.  Through this business, she gets her children ahead in life.  Susana would like to expand her milk business and her farming business.  She is requesting this loan to buy milk, and also seeds for her farmland.

Susana is happy to be receiving her loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy milk, and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Amanda

texts.es:
Amanda D. 47 años D. edad, vive en su casa propia con su familia, la cual no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicada en el distrito D. TambogranD. que pertenece al departamento D. Piura. Esta zona se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y artesanía.

Amanda desD. hace algunos años se dedica a la crianza y venta D. animales D. corral (cerdos y aves D. corral), su corrales se encuentra en la parte posterior D. su casa, los cuales son apropiados y amplios, los alimenta con comida balanceada para que sus animales lleguen a tener un crecimiento óptimo para poderlos ofrecer en los diferentes mercados D. la zona y así obtenga buenas ganancias para solventar sus gastos familiares. También cuenta con tierras D. cultivo donD. siembra limón y una vez que cosecha, tiene otro ingreso económico.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa D. 1500 nuevos soles  para la compra D. alimento balanceado para sus animales y fertilizante para brindar mantenimiento a sus tierras, con las ganancias que obtenga con la venta D. sus animales podrá cubrir su crédito como tener una mejor calidad D. vida.  Amanda es una mujer que con esfuerzo y mucho empeño a sabido salir adelante.
texts.en:
Amanda is 47 years old and lives in her own home with her family.  They do not receive basic services.  Amanda resides in the District of TambogranD., which is part of the Department of Piura.  This area is known for agriculture, livestock breeding, and handicrafts.  

Amanda has been raising and selling domesticates animals, such as pigs and chickens, for a few years.  Her animal pens are located behind her house and are spacious and of the appropriate size.  Their diet consists of balanced feed.  When the animals reach the optimal level of growth, they are offered for sale at different markets in the area.  Amanda earns a good income to cover the family expenses.  She also has farmland on which she grows lemons, which generate another source of income once they are harvested.

Amanda is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1500 PEN in order to buy balanced feed for her animals and fertilizers for maintaining her land.  With the revenue she generates from selling her animals, she will be able to repay her loan and have a better quality of life.  Amanda is a woman who strives to move forward with great effort and determination.

loans.use: to buy balanced animal feed and fertilizers.

loans.name: Serina

texts.en:
Serina is married and has four children. She is 55 years old and she lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental 

Serina sells rice to earn a living and had this business for seven years. Each month, she earns 4,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 25,000 PHP to purchase more fertilizers for her farm. 

Serina has been a member of GDMPC for three years. In the future, Serina hopes to improve her business so that they can help her grandchildren by sending them to school.

loans.use: to purchase more fertilizers for her farm

loans.name: Paulita

texts.en: Paulita, a 40-year-old married mother of three children, lives in the Philippines where she has been raising pigs to earn a living for the last 20 years. A member of PMPC for seven years, she has requested a loan of PHP 17000 to purchase feeds and vitamins for the piglets. In the future, Paulita hopes to have enough savings for family use.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins.

loans.name: Nyamdavaa

texts.en:
Nyamdavaa is a 36-year-old married woman who lives with her daughter in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Her husband works in Korea. Her daughter attends a local high school. Nyamdavaa supports her family by operating a retail clothing stall in the largest outdoor market in Mongolia. When she first began her business in 2002, she had 2,000,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) in working capital. Today it’s increased and become 3,100,000 MNT in working capital. 

This is the second time that Nyamdavaa has requested funding from Kiva and she is really thankful to all Kiva lenders for giving her an opportunity to increase her working capital. With this loan of 1,500,000 MNT, Nyamdavaa will purchase more products for the upcoming season.

loans.use: to purchase more products for the upcoming season.

loans.name: Sointa

texts.en:
Sointa is a 39-year-old married woman who has three children. She has been a mixed farmer for the past five years. She has a good credit history with KADET LTD. This will be her third loan. She plans to use the loan to purchase wheat seeds (grain) and fertilizers. 

She hopes to generate profits from the loan which she would use to expand her farming from small-scale to large-scale commercial farming. She hopes that in the future she will live a better life and see her children's magnificence.

loans.use: to purchase wheat seeds (grain) and fertilizers

loans.name: Eulogio

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “LLANCASUN DE ARIN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Calca, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Eulogio; el tiene 62 años de edad y es casado y tiene 3 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, el socio vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, aceite, leche y galletas, el socio trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio el socio saca adelante a sus hijos, el socio quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar leche, azúcar, arroz, fideos y galletas al por mayor para implementar la tienda de abarrotes. 

 El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Introducing Eulogio, a member of the “Llancasun de Arin” Communal Bank, which is located in Calca, a district of the Calca province in the Cusco department.

Eulogio is 62 years old, he is married and he has 3 children. He alternates his daily chores with his activity, running a grocery store. He sells basic necessities such as rice, sugar, oil, milk and biscuits. He works from 6 am to 10 pm and thanks to this activity he provides for his children. He wants to expand and improve his grocery store, and he is requesting a loan to buy milk, sugar, rice, noodles and biscuits at wholesale price to improve his grocery store.

He is happy about the loan and he commits to complying with the repayment of his dues.

loans.use: To buy milk, sugar, rice, noodles and biscuits at wholesale price.

loans.name: Umedullo

texts.ru: Умедулло женат и имеет троих детей. Он занимается купле- продажей продуктов питания около 6 месяцев. Он вложил в свой бизнес все свои силы, чтобы  поставить себя на ноги. Его торговая точка находится в населенном пункте и уже имеет много клиентов. Умедулло хотел бы получить займ в размере 2000 Сомони для покупки продуктов питания, чтобы пополнить свой оборотный капитал. Он надеется на вашу помощь и заранее благодарен вам за вашу доброту.
texts.en: Umedullo is married and has three children. He has been in the grocery business for about six months. He has put all of his energy into his business in order to get himself established. His retail outlet is in a populated area, and he already has many customers. Umedullo would like to obtain a loan of 2000 som to buy grocery products to replenish his working capital. He looks forward to your assistance and thanks you in advance for your kindness.

loans.use: To buy food products

loans.name: Ayitchevo Group

texts.fr: Le groupement AYITCHEVO est composé de dix huit personnes qui habitent le même village et mènent toutes des activités génératrices de revenus. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupement sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante de ce groupement, du nom de Célestine est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Célestine est âgée de 40 ans et vit au Bénin. Célestine n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Célestine est mariée à un certain Eugène. Le couple a trois enfants dont certains scolarisés et tous à sa charge. Afin d'assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Célestine vend depuis quinze ans de l’huile de palme dans sa région. De façon secondaire, Célestine vend des boules d'akassa (pâte faite à base de l’amidon de manioc). Célestine s’approvisionne dans une région du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Célestine sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupement AYITCHEVO, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le premier prêt a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
AYITCHEVO Group is made up of eighteen persons who live in the same village and run money-earning businesses. This is the second time that the members of the group are seeking financial support from Kiva's partner, ALIDé, in order to bolster their businesses.

The group's representative, named Célestine, is the one raising her hand in the photograph. She's 40 years old and lives in Benin. She's married to one Eugène. The couple has three children to support, out of which some attend school.

Célestine never attended school. In order to cover the various expenses of her family, she's been selling palm oil in her region for fifteen years. As a secondary business, she also sells "akassa balls" (a traditional beninese food, made out cassava starch). She gets her supplies in one of Benin's region.

Eager to satisfy her clientele and in order to increase her revenue and income, Célestine is seeking, together with the other members of the group, a second loan from ALIDé. The first loan was repaid without problems.

loans.use: to buy palm nuts to make palm oil

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Ly is a Tuk Tuk taxi driver, while his wife sells fish. They live in a village near Phnom Penh City and have eight children who attend school. 

Ly is asking for a loan of $1,000 to rebuild his house because it’s small. This makes difficult living conditions for his large family.

loans.use: To rebuild his family's house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Zakia

texts.en:
Zakia, 37, is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. For the past four years, Zakia has operated a restaurant business from home, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Her major dream is to establish a retail shop in the future.

Zakia plans to use this KES 30,000 loan to purchase cooking oil, wheat flour, rice and cereals. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, wheat flour, rice and cereals.

loans.name: Imelda Virginia

texts.en: A few years ago, Imelda's daughter Jamilet, now 4 years old, was playing in the kitchen with fire when unexpectedly the fire exploded severely burning Jamilet.  She has limited movement of her left arm and cannot raise it more than half way. Imelda is a single mother who supports her eight children by selling candies and gum. This loan will help her pay for corrective surgery for her daughter to allow her normal function, vastly improving her quality of life and future opportunities. It is anticipated that a single surgery will completely restore her arm movement.

loans.use: to restore physical movement of her arm after severe burns

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
