Helen owns a retail shop selling sugar, beer and soap and works seven days a week. She rents the shop where she operates. Helen receives at least 10 customers a day and her customers are mainly women and children. She sells at retail. Besides this retail shop business, Helen also sells fried cassava chips and pancakes.  Helen has been in this business for some years and her business challenges include thieves, seasonality and competition. Helen has been with MCDT for many years, servicing her 11th loan.  She wants to use this loan to buy more bags of sugar, more bunches of sweet bananas and crates of beer. She hopes to see her business grow bigger, build her own house and educate her children up to the university level.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, sweet bananas and soap

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en: Rosa is a member of the María Auxiliadora community bank, which is comprised of eleven members, all hailing from the San Sebastian neighborhood of Cusco. Rosa is a 40-year-old mother of three children aged 20, 18, and 17. She lives with her spouse and children in Cusco. Rosa makes a living selling dry goods in one of Cusco’s main plaza markets. She will use the loan to buy more goods to sell so that she can increase her revenue from this business. Rosa is appreciative of and thankful for the loan, and promises to make her monthly payments on time.

loans.use: Dry goods

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 34 ans, 2 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à Sompiya, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font le commerce du bétail, du savon, du pain et le tricotage de la laine.
Ces femmes du groupe Benkadi sont à leur premier prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter du bétail, du savon kabakourouni, de l’arachide, de tissu et de la laine.
DJELIKA S. du groupe Benkadi compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, des tissus et de la laine.
Elle s’approvisionne en tissus et laine avec les commerçants de Wakoro (commune du village de Sompiya) et effectue la vente de ses produits finis sur place et dans les environnants de Sompiya, au comptant, à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 10 000FCFA qui sera utilisé dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités de commerce.
texts.en:
The women of the Benkadi group are all married and average 34 years of age and two children. They all live in extended traditional families in Sompiya, Dioïla Prefecture, in Koulikoro Region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They got acquainted through bonds of kinship, and sell cattle, soap, bread, and knit wool. The women of the Benkadi group are seeking their first solidarity loan (group loan), to be used to buy cattle, "kabakourouni" soap (a locally produced soap), peanuts, fabrics, and wool. DJELIKA S., one of the members of the group, intends to use her loan to buy fabrics and wool. She gets her supplies of fabrics and wool from merchants in Wakoro (part of the Sompiya village), and sells her manufactured products in Sompiya and in the surroundings, for cash, to a clientele comprising mostly women. She expects to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 10'000 (ca US$ 20), to be used for the daily expenses of the family. The remainder will be reinvested in her business.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabrics and wool

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Born in 1956, Rose N.  is married to Chi Joseph and they have brought forth five children. As a woman who does not like to depend on her husband for all the family needs and finding it so difficult to accomplish this task, Rose N.  joined GHAPE in 1998. Also, she has been having a lot of marital problems with her family.This has made her sad all the time but she is appreciative of the fact that she is alive. Her desire is to give her children love and education. She states that she feels better each time she provides something small to her children. Her inability to get investment capital which could constantly generate income for her to meet her children’s needs is what motivated her to obtain a loan from GHAPE.

Given a loan, she plans to buy a two-wheeled motorcycle. She knows this business will succeed because she is located at a good business site and she has a good rider for the motorcycle. She  plans to use the profits generated to sponsor her children in school and to cater for the basic needs of her family.  

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instills a sense of family and community in its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Purchase of a two-wheeled motorcycle

loans.name: Rodelyn

texts.en:
Rodelyn P. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 38 years old. Rodelyn is married and has 3 school-aged children. Rodelyn owns & operates a livestock business, raising pigs for fattening and sale. Rodelyn has been engaged in her business for over 3 years.

In 2007, Rodelyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Rodelyn is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Rodelyn from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to supplement her family's income. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr: monsieur M. est un homme marié, il réside avecc sa femme dans le quartier de gbenyédi qui est un quartier périphérique de la ville de Lomé, en  2002,il s'est lancée dans le commerce de détail de produits laitiers appelé "FAN MILK". il exerce ce commerce dans sa propre boutique qu'il a appelé " COGECO". il voudrait gonfler son stock de produits laitiers qui est épuisé raison pour laquelle il sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat de divers produits laitiers auprès de la société FAN MILK
texts.en:
Mr. M. is married and lives with his wife in the Gbenyédi district, an outlying area of the city of Lomé. In 2002, he began retailing dairy products called “FAN MILK.” He operates his business in his own shop which he calls “CONGECO.” He would like to replenish his stock of dairy products which is depleted. This is why he is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy various dairy products from the FAN MILK company.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of FAN MILK dairy products

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: La Sra. Ana María se dedica a la venta de verduras en las ferias de la zona sur , cliente que es bastante responsable con sus obligaciones así lo demostró todo este tiempo , también podemos indicar que la cliente es muy trabajadora ya que este ultimo tiempo mostro crecimiento en su actividad con la que sostiene a su hogar conformado por 4 integrantes y es la única que percibe ingresos en su hogar y por lo tanto la única que mantiene a su familia, por todo lo mencionado se le dio la tasa kiva, con el dinero del crédito comprara mercadería como cebolla por quintales, zanahoria, yuca, haba, espinaca, etc. Esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindad en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en:
Ana María sells vegetables at markets in the south and is constantly demonstrating how responsible she is. She is also very hardworking and has already seen her business grow, which allows her to support her 4-person household. She is the only family member with an income, and thus its sole provider. Because of her work she was awarded a Kiva loan. She will use the loan to buy merchandise such as onions, carrots, yucca, haba (type of bean), spinach, etc. She is grateful to Emprender (Kiva Field Partner) and Kiva for giving her the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Sindewald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Resupply merchandise in bulk on a regular basis

loans.name: Sarita

texts.es: Sarita, de 50 años, es una mujer que siempre ha trabajo muy duro por sobresalir en la vida, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Hugo de 50 años y sus 4 hijos, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. El trabajo que realiza Sarita es cultivar zanahorias, papa y arveja, labor que la realiza junto a su esposo, quien también trabaja arduamente para brindarles una buena educación a sus hijos. Ella ha visto por conveniente llevar sus productos hasta Bolivia, según manifiesta, es ahí donde mejores ganancias obtiene, por ello procura cuidar sus plantaciones de las plagas de insectos y cuidarlas con fertilizantes. Con el tiempo espera que sus productividad mejore, para que las ventas sean más rápidas y sus ingresos económicos aumenten. Este es el décimo crédito con MFP, se siente en la obligación de pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a las socias de su grupo comunal, en donde es muy querida. Con los dos mil quinientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono para sus cultivos y contratará un operario para que trabaje en la siembra.
texts.en:
Sarita is 50 years old and she has always been someone who has worked very hard in her life. She lives in her own home together with her husband Hugo, 50 years old, and their 4 children. They are the reason for all their efforts. Sarita's work is to harvest carrots, potatoes and sweet peas. She works alongside her husband who has also worked very hard to provide their kids with a good education. She has seen it profitable to go to Bolivia with her products as they become available. That is where she gets the best prices. She makes sure to provide only the best care of her plantations, warding against insects and fertilize as needed. In time she hopes to increase her productivity so that her sales will be better and her earnings increase. This is her tenth loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner). She is committed to making her payments on time, not wanting to cause any problems to her community group colleagues, where she is very well liked. With the two thousand five hundred soles she requests she will purchase more fertilizers for her fields and she will hire the help she needs in the plantations.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia B. is from the village of Tambagan, Medina, Misamis Oriental. She is 50 years old and is married. Virginia owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling bananas in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Virginia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional bananas to sell. Virginia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 4th from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita A. is a married woman who lives in Totong, Brgy. Talacagay, Hinoba-an, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating 3 business ventures: general store, livestock, and farming. Her husband Fortunato A., who is 58 years old, raises livestock and farms to earn his living. They have 1 child who is already married at 25.

Lolita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 6 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Lolita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 18,000 helped her increase her monthly profit to PHP 11,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 7th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 19,000, which she intends to use to purchase more stock to sell in her General Store so that she can continue to save up for future home repairs. Lolita A. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Tuzamurane Group

texts.en:
Jeanne is 25 years old. She is married and has one child who is 2 and a half years old. Her husband is a soldier. Jeanne sells green bananas and Irish potatoes. She has had this business for five years. With this loan, she will buy more green bananas and Irish potatoes. She plans to save the profit from her business. She says that her business is well known by all her clients and that is why she has succeeded. In the future, she would like to upgrade her business and start selling new products like clothes.

Jeanne is the leader of a borrowing group called 'Tuzamurane Group'. Tuzamurane is a Kinyarwanda word that means 'Rise Together' in English. She is in the back row with her hand raised.

loans.use: To buy more bananas and Irish potatoes to sell

loans.name: Itiala

texts.en: Itiala Y. is currently in the business of baking and selling local Sudanese bread like tamia, legemat, etc  and is requesting a loan to stock more baking flour to bake more bread to sell.  Itiala is 30 years old and is married. Her husband is a police man. She has 3 children and her children do not go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up restaurant.

loans.use: To buy additional supplies of baking flour to bake more bread to sell

loans.name: Zubaida's Group

texts.en:
Zubaida is a widow and resides in a city named Mian Chano in Pakistan. She lives there in a 2-room brick house with her family. She has an extended family, where her brother-in-law also lives with her family. 

Zubaida keeps herself busy by operating her dairy business. She keeps some buffaloes at her home, from whom she gets milk to sell in her neighboring areas.  She also has a grocery store at her home. She uses a room in her house for this purpose. After finishing selling the milk, she tends to her grocery shop business.
  
Zubaida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her dairy business. With the loan, she will buy another buffalo.  That will help her increase the milk quantity and fulfill the demands of more customers. 

She hopes that this loan investment will help her business grow further and she will be able to provide better facilities in life to her family.   She is a new loan user of Asasah and this is her first loan application.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo for dairy business

loans.name: Elsa Maria

texts.es: Elsa tiene 61 años, vive con su esposo sus hijos que ya son adultos viven de manera independiente. Ella tiene la venta de mercadería en general pues sale  todos los días a vender productos y en su vivienda. Donde ofrece una gran variedad de productos como toallas, sabanas, cosméticos, calzado y bisutería.  Atiende todos los días desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche. A pesar de las dificultades que ha enfrentado a salido adelante. El financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima. Sus metas son tener una gran tienda localizada en el mercado.
texts.en: Elsa is 61 years old and lives with her husband. Her children are already adults and live on their own. Elsa sells general supplies and goes out every day to sell products and also does it out of her home, where she offers a wide variety of products like towels, sheets, cosmetics, footwear and jewelry. She works every day from 7 a.m. until 9 p.m. Despite the difficulties that have confronted her she keeps making headway. She is requesting the loan to purchase more merchandise. Her goal is to have a bigger store located in the market.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Velky Dinora

texts.es:
la sra. Velky V. tiene 32 años de edad, vive en la colonia Flor del Campo y se dedica a costurar su especialidad son los Cobertores para muebles, cojines y cortinas. su taller de costura esta ubicado en su casa de habitacion, Velky cuenta con tres maquinas industriales y una sorgeteadora. su producto lo vende en Tegucigalpa y los fines de semana viaja a la ciudad de choluteca para vender su producto.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de materia prima para fabricar sus cobertores, cojines y cortinas.
con las ganancias que obtenga poder cubrir los gastos de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Velky V. is 32 years old.  She lives in Flor del Campo neighborhood and her business is sewing.  Her speciality is making furniture covers, cushions and drapes.  Her sewing workshop is located in her home.  Velky has three industrial sewing machines and an overlocking machine.  She sells her products in Tegucigalpa and on weekends she travels to the city of Choluteca to sell her products.

She will use her loan to buy raw materials for making her covers, cushions and drapes.  She will use the profits she makes to cover her children's expenses.

loans.use: To buy fabric, thread, zippers, and spare parts for her sewing machines

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Compra de maíz para la elaboración de arepas

loans.name: Roxana Lissette

texts.es:
Roxana, tiene 34 años de edad, reside en Usulután, vive con su esposo y sus hijas, se dedica a la venta de tortillas y merienda, este negocio lo tiene hace 3 años, con la ayuda de sus hijas lo realiza cada día, su único inconveniente por el momento es no tener un inventario de materiales para producir la venta.
Por esta situación solicita un préstamo para la compra de maíz y alimentos para preparar las meriendas, como pollo, queso, frijoles y aceite, este préstamo le permitirá tener materiales a su disposición para preparar la venta en el momento que desee, además de que con este préstamo estará fortaleciendo el negocio y mantenerlo por vario tiempo para proveer ingresos a su hogar.
Su objetivo es mantener el negocio e ir mejorándolo poco a poco para lograr un aumento en la clientela y en la producción de los alimentos, de esta manera mantener en buenas condiciones el negocio.
texts.en:
Roxana is 34 years old and lives in Usulután with her husband and her daughters. She sells tortillas and lunch. She has had this business for three years. She works every day with the help of her daughters. Her only obstacle right now is that she does not have an inventory of supplies to make her sales. This is why she is requesting a loan to buy corn and food such as chicken, cheese, beans and oil to prepare lunches. This loan will allow her to have supplies at her disposal to prepare food when she needs to. This loan is to strengthen her business and to keep it going for some time so that she can provide the income to her home. 

Her goal is to sustain her business and to keep improving it little by little so that she can increase her customers and the production of food and to maintain the business in good condition.

loans.use: Purchase corn and food to prepare lunches.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es: Lidia, de 32 años, vive en su casa que es propia al lado de su esposo German de 32 años que es profesor y de su pequeña hija. En la actualidad esta emprendedora mujer posee una librería, negocio que le genera ganancias debido a que se encuentra ubicada cerca a un colegio. Durante todo este tiempo, pudo ahorrar suficiente capital, así pudo lograr comprar una fotocopiadora y ahora realiza este servicio de fotocopiado de documentos. Se siente muy satisfecha con el negocio que tiene ya que obtiene regulares ganancias de las ventas. Hoy ha invertido en otra librería, en donde un empleado que contrato lo esta ayudando en la atención de los clientes. Manifiesta que no puede salir mucho por no descuidar ambos negocios, y como es una mujer trabajadora tiene planeado mejorar las instalaciones de ambos negocios para ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Es el segundo crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Lidia tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de cuadernos, papelería en general además de útiles escolares que necesita para surtir mejor ambos negocios, y ofrecer variedad a sus compradores.
texts.en: Lidia, 32, lives in a house she owns along with her husband German, also 32 and a teacher, and her small daughter. Currently, this entrepreneurial woman owns a bookstore, a business that is profitable because it is near a school. She was able to save enough to purchase a photocopier and now she provides copying services. Lidia feels very satisfied with her business as she can receive steady income from her sales. She has invested in another bookstore where an employee she hired helps her serve customers. She mentions that she cannot go out much because she does not want to neglect her businesses and since she is an entrepreneurial woman she wants to improve upon the facilities to offer a better service to her clients. This is her second loan with MFP. She promises to make her payments on time because she does not want to let down those who are helping her get ahead. Lidia plans to invest the money received in the purchase of notebooks, stationary, as well as school supplies that are needed to increase her merchandise and offer variety to her customers.

loans.use: Purchase stationary and notebooks.

loans.name: Batsuh

texts.en:
Batsuh is 46 years old and lives with his wife and two daughters in the Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. For the past twelve years, Batsuh and his family have lived in their own house. His older daughter goes to university and his younger daughter attends the local middle school. 

Since 1999, Batsuh and his wife have operated a meat trading business. In August of 2010, Batsuh began to work as a driver in a military unit. His wife continues the meat trading business and, when he is able, Batsuh helps his wife. In the beginning, their working capital was 300,000 MNT. Currently, their working capital exceeds 2,000,000 MNT. Batsuh is a hardworking person and he is requesting 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase wholesale goat meat to sell in the spring months.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale goat meat

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Sam Y., 53, is skilled at making furniture.  His main activity is selling rattan cupboards and beds. He sells these products, which he and his wife make at home or they order from other rattan weavers who live in the village. 

Sam Y. and his wife have three children, one of whom is married. Two of their daughters are employed: One has been working in the sewing industry for years and the other is a rattan weaver. In order to make additional income, Sam Y. is asking for a loan from Kiva to buy planks so that he can go on making beds for sale.

loans.use: To buy planks to make beds for sale.

loans.name: Alberto Jose

texts.es: Alberto José está casado y tiene 2 hijos que asisten a un colegio público, ya que no tiene los suficientes ingresos para mantenerlos en un privado. Su actividad económica es una pulpería, que está ubicada en su vivienda. Actualmente el se encuentra muy bien establecido en su vivienda, aunque no fue fácil enfrentar todas las dificultades por lo la que tuvo que atravesar. Ahora está solicitando un financiamiento que será utilizado para capital de trabajo para la compra de granos básicos, jugos, pan, dulces, huevos y gaseosas. Tiene el sueño de incrementar su negocio para que el día de mañana esto les asegure el futuro a sus 2 hijos.
texts.en: Alberto José is married and has two children that go to a public school, as he doesn’t have earn enough to keep them in a private school.  He has a local store located within his house.  He is currently well established in his house, although it was not easy to get through the difficulties he came across.  Now he is requesting a loan that will be used for working capital to buy basic grains, juices, bread, sweets, eggs, and sodas.  His dream is to expand his business so that he can ensure his two children’s future for tomorrow.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Runelyn

texts.en:
Runelyn B. is from the village of Binakalan, Gingoog City. She is 25 years old. Runelyn is married and has three school-aged children. 

To make a living, Runelyn sells green and sweet bananas  in the local community. Runelyn has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Runelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Runelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. 

Runelyn is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional green and yellow bananas to sell. This will be the seventh loan taken out by Runelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional green and yellow bananas to sell

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
Marcelina tiene 40 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos, y vive junto a su familia en el distrito costero de San José, ubicado a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital del departamento de Lambayeque.

Se gana la vida desde hace tres años criando y vendiendo animales menores en corrales ubicados en la parte posterior de su domicilio, Marcelina cría a su ganado  y cuando ya han alcanzado un buen punto de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que siempre visitan la zona en donde vive.

Marcelina desea adquirir alimento balanceado para mejorar la alimentación de su ganado y venderlo a un mejor precio. Para lograr su objetivo ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Marcelina es una mujer luchadora y que siempre da lo mejor se si para sacar adelante a sus hijos, su mayor anhelo es verlos convertidos en personas de bien y exitosas.
texts.en:
Marcelina is 40 years old, has 2 children, and lives with her family in the coastal San José District located 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque Department.

For three years she has been raising and selling small animals in the back part of her home. Marcelina raises her livestock and when they have developed enough she sells them to buyers who visit the area.

Marcelina wishes to buy a balanced feed for her livestock so that they can be healthier to sell. To do this she has requested Edpyme Alternatia a 1500 Peruvian Soles loan.

Marcelina is a hardworking woman and always gives her best to help her children succeed in life. Her biggest wish is to raise them to be good and successful individuals.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for her livestock

loans.name: Norberto

texts.en:
Norberto T. Jr. is from the village of La Victoria, Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur. He is 31 years old. Norberto is single. To make a living, he provides printing press services in the local community. He has been engaged in his business for over four years and earns approximately $143 a month for these activities.

In 2011, Norberto joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to repair his printing machine for better service and to invest in expanding the business. This will be his 1st loan from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair his printing machine for better service.

location.town: La Victoria, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Almira

texts.en:
Almira is 36 years old and has a common-law husband with two children.  Almira works very hard to provide for them. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional groceries for her store to sell.

Almira has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, cigarettes, sugar and other groceries. 

In the future Almira would like to save money to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy additional groceries for her sari-sari (variety) store.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is 58 years old and a widow with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Leonila has a general store business in the Philippines. Leonila requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount NWTF to purchase more stock of goods to sell.

Leonila has been in this business for two years.  In the future, Leonila would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married. 

Grace has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & different kinds of beverages. She has had this business for four years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy additional stocks of groceries & beverages.

Grace has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Grace hopes to expand  her business so that she could be able to provide the needs of her neighborhood and the rest of the of her family needs.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries & beverages to sell

loans.name: Kuña Mbarete Group

texts.es:
Este grupo surgió por promociones realizadas en la zona, el grupo se encuentra en el 6º ciclo, opera con la Fundación desde el año 2009.  
Una de las integrantes del grupo, la Sra. Pelagia, tiene 3 hijos estudiantes, su marido trabaja en metalúrgica y cuenta con un buen ingreso, ella se dedica a las manualidades (pintura sobre tela) y también a la repostería hace varios años.
Cuenta la Sra. Pelagia solicita el credito lo utiliza para la compra de telas, pinturas y también a la compra de insumos para la elaboración de sus tortas, ella se considera una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable, a quien ningun desafio la asusta.
Todas las señoras del grupo también  realizan actividades productivas como ser : venta de ropas, venta de productos de limpieza, venta de comidas, etc.
texts.en:
This group was formed as a result of promotional activities that took place in their area.  The group is in its sixth loan cycle and has been working with Fundación Paraguaya since 2009.

One of the members of this group is Pelagia.  She has three children who are all studying.  Her husband is a metallurgist and has a good income.  Pelagia makes crafts (she paints on fabric).  She has also been making confectionery for several years. 

Pelagia is requesting this loan to buy fabric, paints and also some supplies for making her cakes.  She considers herself to be a hard-working and responsible woman who isn't afraid of any challenge.

All the ladies in this group carry out their own business activities such as: selling clothes, selling cleaning products, selling meals, etc.

loans.use: to buy fabric, paints and also supplies for making her cakes

loans.name: Elsita

texts.en:
Elsita is a hard working mother who has 4 school-aged children. She is now 42 years old and has had a food selling business for almost 5 years. 

Elsita sells food like hard boiled eggs, boiled chicken embryo (balut), fruits and vegetables, to the people in her community. Elsita earns approximately PHP 4,000 each month in her food selling business. 

Elsita is asking for a loan of PHP 8,000 to purchase additional fruits and vegetables to sell.

In the future, Elsita hopes to become successful in this kind of business through the continuous assistance of the Kiva lenders. She believes that someday, her business will grow more and their children will finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase additional fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Faten

texts.en:
Faten is a 33-year-old young woman who is married and has four sons. Faten is a taxi driver and needs to pay taxi insurance and licensing, but with the decent income the taxi returns, she had to take a $1,000 loan from FATEN to cover the fees. 

Faten's husband transports the passengers inside the city and works on being hired by an agency that transports passengers inside and between cities to have a better income.

Faten is a conservative woman. Therefore, her husband is photographed instead of her next to the car.

loans.use: To pay for taxi insurance, licensing and repairs

loans.name: Melodina

texts.en:
Melodina, 41, is married and has four children. One is in school. 

Melodina has a food-production business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

Melodina requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-production business.

In the future, Melodina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-production business.

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.en:
Eusebia is 37 years old and has four children. Eusebia is married and has three children who are in school.

Eusebia is in the agricultural business farming vegetables in the Philippines. Eusebia requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Eusebia has been farming vegetables for 6 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Eusebia would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: San Isidro Group

texts.es:
El comité San Isidro se formó gracias a que una D. las miembros se acercó a la oficina D. Fundación Paraguaya a interiorizarse del programa D. mujeres emprendedoras, luego D. esto comentó a sus amigas y vecinas y D. allí surge dicho grupo. Todas ellas son mujeres muy sacrificadas y luchadoras, que buscan, por medio D. su trabajo en pan diario para sus familias.
Un Ejemplo D. lucha es la señora Emiliana, ella se dedica a la cría y posterior venta D. animales; ella por medio D. este trabajo logra generar los ingresos necesarios para poder mantener a su familia. Comenta que este es un trabajo muy sacrificado, pues tiene que alimentar y cuidar a los animales y velar por que no tengan ninguna enfermedad. Uno D. sus sueños es poder tener una granja donD. pueda criar todo tipo D. animales.
Ella solicita el crédito para al compra D. animales, como así también alimento para los mismos. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da, pues D. obtener el crédito le será D. gran ayuda.
texts.en:
The San Isidro Communal Bank was formed thanks to one of the members approaching the office of the Fundación Paraguaya [Paraguay Foundation] to familiarize herself with the entrepreneurial women’s program. Later she told her friends and neighbors about it and this group came about from there. All of the women are self-sacrificing and fighters who seek their family’s daily bread through their work. 

One example is the fight of Emiliana. She breeds and sells animals. It is through this work that she earns the necessary income to proviD. for her family. She says this work causes her to make many sacrifices, as she has to feed and care for the animals and watch over them so they remain disease free. One of her dreams is to be able to have a farm where she can raise all types of animals.

She is asking for a loan in order to buy animals, as well as feed for them. She thanks the Foundation for the opportunity it gives her because getting the loan will be a big help.

loans.use: to purchase animals and animal feed for them.

loans.name: Orlando

texts.es: Orlando, de 30 años, es un hombre sociable y trabajador, vive en su propia morada situado en la comunidad de Quillabamba. Los verdes campos de la selva tropical, han sido en la vida de Orlando un lugar muy agradable para trabajar, desde muy pequeño sus padres le enseñaron esta labor y ahora cuenta con sus propias parcelas en las que trabaja con mucho esmero y sacrificio sus cultivos de cacao, café, frutos de plátano y maní, poseyendo en total 02 hectáreas de terreno. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras, ya que así siente que los meses de arduo trabajo le brindan como recompensa la calidad de sus frutos. Lleva 08 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus cultivos desde su comunidad hasta los centros de acopio situado en la ciudad de Quimbiri y San Francisco. Con el crédito solicitado comprará materiales para refaccionar su vivienda. Con el tiempo, espera juntar el dinero suficiente para comprar nuevas tierras para luego heredarlos a sus queridos hijos. Este será su primer crédito de Orlando y esta muy contento de saber que contará con el apoyo de todos ustedes y así progresar gracias al apoyo de ellos. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles, comprará materiales de construcción para poder refaccionar su vivienda.
texts.en:
30-year-old Orlando is a sociable and hard-working man who lives in his own home in the community of Quillabamba.  The green fields of the tropical rainforest have been a very pleasant place for Orlando to work throughout his life.  His parents taught him this work when he was very young and now he owns his own plots of land where he works on his cacao, coffee, banana and peanut crops with a lot of care and sacrifice.  He has 2 hectares of land in total.

What Orlando most enjoys about his work is harvesting his land as that is when he feels that the months of hard work are providing their reward in the quality of his fruit.  He has been in this business for eight years and he considers the most difficult part of his work to be transporting his crops from his community to the storage warehouses in the towns of Quimbiri and San Francisco.

Orlando will use the loan he has requested to buy materials with which to refurbish his home.  Over time, he hopes to be able to put together enough money to buy new land so that he can then leave them to his beloved children as an inheritance.  This will be Orlando's first loan and he is very happy to know that he will have the support of each of you and thereby be able to make progress.  He will use his 3,000 soles to buy building supplies with which to refurbish his home.

loans.use: to buy building supplies to improve the infrastructure of his home

loans.name: Ligia

texts.es:
Después D. convertirse en madre cabeza D. hogar, Ligia se dedicó a trabajar incansablemente para sacar adelante a sus 4 hijos, día a día se rebusca la manera D. generar ingresos que le permitan mejorar su calidad D. vida, por ello, desD. hace algún tiempo se dedica a la cría D. cerdos y pollos, y como ingreso adicional venD. arepas a sus vecinos y allegados.

Para continuar con este negocio y esperando ampliar sus clientes, Ligia necesita un préstamo para comprar 2 cerdos, cuido para los cerdos y pollos para el engorD. D. los mismos, y así ser más productiva y generar mayores ingresos ya que se aproxima la época D. diciembre. 

A sus 61 años D. edad, esta emprendedora sueña con poder ofrecerles a sus hijos la oportunidad D. tener un mejor futuro para ellos y los nietos que llegarán, por eso trabaja con gran dedicación y esfuerzo.
texts.en: Once she became the head of her household, Ligia devoted herself to working tirelessly to proviD. for her 4 children.  She is constantly looking for ways to generate income that will allow her to improve her quality of life.  For some time now she has been raising pigs and chickens, and for extra income she sells corn cakes to her friends and neighbors.  In order to continue with her livestock business, and because she is hoping to increase her customer base, Ligia needs a loan to buy 2 pigs, and pig and chicken feed to fatten her animals.  In this way she will be more productive and can generate better earnings, since we are approaching the end of the year.  At 61 years of age, this enterprising woman dreams of providing her children with the opportunity to have a better future for themselves and for the grandchildren to come.  For this reason, she works with great dedication and effort.

loans.use: to buy 2 pigs, and to buy animal feed to fatten her pigs and chickens

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 48 years old, married and has three school-aged children. She has been managing her hog raising business for three years. She describes herself as a patient and industrious mother.

Her business serves as a source of income for the family that helps her provide their daily needs. Now she is requesting a loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos to buy feed and vaccine for raising her piglets. She wants to develop her business to earn a higher income and save some of it for any future emergencies in her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccine for raising her piglets

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta, 59 years old, is married and has six children, four of them still attending school. She enjoys selling grocery items such as milk, coffee, sugar and biscuits in her store. She has been operating her business for almost six years. Her daily profit of PHP 200 is used for daily meals and as revolving capital in her store. Violeta needs to replenish each item sold by the end of the week to keep generating income and meet all of her customers' needs.

Violeta is now asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy soft drinks, canned goods, breads, eggs, detergent and soap to sell in her store. These additional items would help improve her sales. In the future, Violeta wants to save enough money to continuously finance her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, canned goods, breads, eggs, detergent and soap to sell in her store

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 60 years old. She is a widow with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Elsie has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Elsie requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

Elsie has been in this business for 13 years. Elsie would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Nyota A Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Nyota A Group in Western Kenya! Gladys is the facilitator of the Nyota A SHG group. Gladys takes care of four children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access the most competitive prices for fertilizer and quality seed. In the recent 2011 season, Gladys had an excellent maize yield harvesting 30 bags on 1.5 acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Gladys was only able to harvest 5 bags of maize on 1.5 acre of land. With income from maize sales, Gladys will pay for school fees and other major annual expenses for the family. 

This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. In 2012, the members of Nyota A SHG group will each plant between 1 and 2 acres of maize. With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Gladys and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February, 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

loans.use: to source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: Maria Liduvina

texts.es:
María Liduvina tiene 60 años de edad es casada tiene tres hijos, vive con el esposo y con los hijos de 15, 20 y 12 años de edad en el Cantón Chillanes Provincia  de Bolívar.
La VRC la florida está conformada por 12 socios y socias esta ubicada en el Cantón Chillanes a 5 minutos de la oficina.
María se dedica a la Agricultura al cultivo de maíz y frejol además se dedica a al venta de confitería.
Las compras y las ventas lo realizan en Chillanes cada fin de semana. Solicita el crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas, con la ayuda del crédito mejorará la calidad de vida y la del producto. 
El sueño es poder brindarles el apoyo a los hijos para que puedan culminar los estudios.
El desafío al que se ha enfrentado a diario son los intermediarios.
 Se considera una persona responsable, honrada humilde y trabajadora, le gusta disfrutar de las festividades de Santa Rita.
texts.en:
María Liduvina, 60, is married and has three children.  She lives with her husband and children who are 15, 20 and 12 years old in Chillanes Canton, Bolívar Province.

The “La Florida” communal bank has 12 members, both men and women, and is located in Chillanes Canton five minutes from the office.  María is a corn and broad bean farmer and she also sells sweets.  Hers purchases and her sales take place every weekend in Chillanes Canton.

She requests the loan to be able to buy farm supplies.  With help from the loan she will improve the quality of her life and of her product.  Her dream is to support her children so that they finish their schooling.  Her challenge is middlemen.  She considers herself to be a responsible, honest, humble and hardworking person.  In her free time she likes to enjoy the Saint Rita Day festivities.

loans.use: para comprar insumos agrícolas

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr:
Akossiwa est une femme âgé(e) de 39 ans. Elle est mariée à un revendeur de CD et en même temps conducteur de taxi moto. Elle a 04 enfants.
Akossiwa travaille comme couturière à domicile depuis 2007. Elle vend aussi des tissus . Son approvisionnement se fait à Lomé.
Akossiwa a requis son premier  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter plus de marchandises(tissus) afin de répondre  à la demande des clients en cette période de fête.
texts.en:
Akossiwa is 39 years old and married to a CD reseller, who is also a motorcycle taxi driver. The couple have 4 children.

Akossiwa has been working at home as a seamstress since 2007, and she also sells fabrics. She gets her supplies in Lomé and is requesting her first loan from WAGES in order to restock on fabric, so that she can better respond to customer demand during the end of year holiday season.

loans.use: to restock on fabric.

loans.name: Ishema Group

texts.fr:
Zachée  fait partie du groupe Ishema. Il a 32 ans et il est marié avec 4 enfants de 3 à 10 ans, dont 2 scolarisés. Il a 1 personne en charge autre que ses enfants. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Zachée est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’utiliser la semence sélectionne. Dans les prochaines années, Zachée voudrait agrandir la surface de culture de riz. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer et scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en:
Zachée is part of the Ishema group. He is 32 years old. He is married and has four children ranging from three to ten years old, two of whom are in school. He takes care of one other person beyond his children. He has a first-grade education.

Zachée grows rice. This is his first loan with ACB. He will use his loan to purchase chemical fertilizers. 

His business growth strategy is to use specially selected seeds. In the coming years, Zachée would like to increase the size of his rice field. With the income, he will raise and educate his children.

loans.use: to purchase chemical fertilizers.

loans.name: Lorpu

texts.en: Lorpu is 44 years old and lives in Kakata Town. She is married and has three children between the ages of 6 and 14, all of whom are presently in school and live at home. For the past fifteen years, Lorpu has been selling groundnut in the local market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more groundnut  for her business. She plans to continue to educate her children and to build a house in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more groundnut.

loans.name: Kunduz

texts.ru:
Кундуз 31 год, воспитывает  четверых детей. В поисках источника финансирования для своей семьи, 10 лет назад Кундуз начала свой бизнес в откорме и перепродаже скота, стартовав с покупки одной дойной коровы. Молоко и молочные продукты, такие как айран (кисломолочный продукт), сметана, творог Кундуз продает на местном базаре.  Такая деятельность позволяет Кундуз зарабатывать около 10,000 сом (KGS)в месяц.
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Кундуз обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку трех голов скота. Доходы Кундуз планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота, в будущем мечтает дать достойное образование своим детям.
texts.en:
Kunduz is 31 years old and raising four children. In search of a source of funding for her family, Kunduz started her business of fattening and reselling cattle 10 years ago, having started with the purchase of one dairy cow. Kunduz sells milk and dairy products, such as ayran (cultured milk product), sour cream and cottage cheese, at the local bazaar. This activity allows Kunduz to earn around 10,000 som (KGS) per month. 

In order to further develop her business, Kunduz turned to the organization "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS), for the purchase of three head of cattle. Kunduz plans to invest the income in further increasing the number of livestock, and dreams of giving her children a decent education in the future.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Valentine

texts.en:
Valentine is a forty-year-old married woman living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. For the last twelve years she has been farming on a commercial basis, and this has enabled her to build a house and educate her children. She has challenges of seasonal weather and price fluctuations. 

Her business dream is to expand her banana and coffee plantation, and her family goal is to educate her children up to the University. Valentine needs the loan facility to buy coffee and bananas for planting.

loans.use: to buy coffee and bananas for planting.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Ruth buy water pump, organic manure, and insecticides to maximize yield

loans.name: Kossigan

texts.en:
Mr. Kossigan A. was born in Tohoun Togo on 12 December, 1975. After grade school he emigrated to Benin in order to learn to be a mechanic which he never practiced due to the lack of opportunity. He is married and has two children. He struggles daily to provide for the needs of his small family by doing odd jobs. His hopes lay in a new enterprise he undertook with his cousin selling parts to motorcycles and scooters. Through this small business Mr. A. has acquired a significant amount of experience to open his own shop.

Today, for better or worse, his shop is able to stay open, but only through great difficulty. This is why he is asking for a loan of $1200 to buy bulk quantities of loose motorcycle parts in order to better satisfy his customers.

Given the courage, devotion and especially the experience of this young man, this loan will provide him with a "second wind" as he struggles to manage his shop and will enable him to improve his currently precarious economic situation.

Translated from French by Chloé Tuot, a Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur A. Kossigan est né à Tohoun dans le Moyen Mono le 12 décembre 1975. Après ses études primaires, il émigra au Bénin pour apprendre la mécanique qu’il n’a pas eu le temps d’exercer faute de moyen financier. Marié et père de deux enfants, il doit fermement lutter pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille à travers de petites activités occasionnelles. Son espoir viendra d’un cousin qui lui proposa de gérer sa boutique de vente de pièces détachées pour engins à deux roues. C’est dans la gestion de cette affaire qu’il acquiert son expérience et décida lui-même d’ouvrir sa propre boutique.

Aujourd’hui tant bien que mal, il arrive à émerger mais, faute de moyens suffisants, le démarrage est très difficile. C’est pourquoi il sollicite un appui financier de $1200 pour renforcer son commerce par l’achat en gros des pièces détachées afin de pouvoir satisfaire ses clients. Vu le courage, le dévouement et surtout l’expérience de ce jeune homme, ce financement lui donnera un second souffle dans la gestion de son commerce et lui permettra surtout de sortir de sa situation économique très précaires.

loans.use: motorcycle parts shop

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is a 36 year-old woman from the small town of Monte Mercedes. Her husband’s name is Rogelio Sequec and she has five children. She shows herself to be a very good mother, which is demonstrated by the fact that when she married, she also adopted as her own her husband’s two children from a previous marriage. Of her own five children, four are currently studying.

She only made it to third grade and couldn’t continue studying because she had many brothers and sisters. Her father preferred that only the boys study until sixth grade, and she was destined to work in the kitchen with her mother. On occasion, her father would take her to the fields to help out with the corn crop and to do other agricultural work.

When she was 22 years old, she married and moved to the town of Concepción, Sololá, which is where she lives now. She works with her family to grow onions and they also have a small store.

Loan: Rosita says that being able to invest capital in her business has been one of the best things that has happened to her. She realized that the amount she received almost seven months ago has made a difference in her business. She has been able to supply her store better and her sales have increased accordingly. The amount she is currently requesting is Q. 4,000.00 Guatemalan Quetzals (approx. $450.00).

Dreams: When asked about her dreams, she responds with tears in her eyes… “I don’t want my children to suffer like I have suffered from not knowing many of the things one learns in school. For this reason, my husband and I have decided to help our children get ahead, so that someday they won’t have to work in the fields like we have had to do, because it is very hard work.”

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Rosita, es una mujer de 36 años de edad originaria de la aldea Monte Mercedes, esposa de Rogelio Sequec, madre de cinco niños y demuestra ser muy buena madre ya que cuando se caso también adopto como propios a dos hijos de su esposo de un matrimonio anterior, de sus cuatro hijos propios cuatro están actualmente estudiando

Ella únicamente alcanzo el primer grado de primaria pero ya no pudo continuar debido a que eran muchos hermanos y el padre prefirió darles estudio únicamente a sus hijos varones hasta sexto de primaria y ella fue destinada a trabajar con la madre en la cocina y en ocasiones el padre se la llevaba al campo a trabajar en el calzado de la milpa y algunos otros trabajos agrícolas

A los veintidós años se caso y se traslado al municipio de Concepción, Sololá en donde vive actualmente y se dedica junto a su familia al cultivo de cebolla, a la administración de una pequeña tienda

CREDITO: Ella manifiesta que el brindarle un capital para su negocio ha sido una de las mejores cosas que le ha pasado, pues ella se da cuenta que con el monto que recibió hace casi siete meses ha visto un progreso en su negocio, ha podido surtir mejor su tienda y ve que las ventas igualmente han mejorado muchísimo. El monto que solicita actualmente es de: Q. 4,000.00.<7p>

SUEÑOS: Con lagrimas en los ojos… ella responde… • No quiero que mis hijos pequeños sufran como yo he sufrido por no saber mucho de los que se aprende en la escuela. Por eso nos hemos propuesto sacar adelante a nuestros hijos con mi esposo, para que algún día ellos no trabajen en el campo como lo hemos hecho nosotros, pues es un trabajo muy duro

loans.use: To grow vegetables and to buy merchandise for her basic goods store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in a new cart

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
People can't live without garri (a popular West African dish made from cassava tubers) and firewood, says Rose O. who is married with six children and lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. Rose is 56 years old, and has been a client of LAPO for 3 years. She has been in the garri and firewood business since 1980.

She hopes to buy more foodstuffs and improve her business with the $175 loan she is requesting.

loans.use: To buy bags of garri and firewood for sale

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Mrs. Helen O. is 36 years old and is married to Mr. O. with four children. She lives in Benin City, she sells cloth and tailoring material, and also she sews female clothes. She started her business in 2005. She needs $825 to buy more tailoring material and an additional sewing machine. She is a dedicated LAPO client.

loans.use: Helen would like to buy more tailoring material & cloth for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Juliano

texts.en:
Juliano, 45, is the mother of Kwesi, 5 (in picture above), and twin boys, 22. The twins are currently studying at the University of Cape Coast. Juliano hopes to earn enough money to support all of them through their education.

Right now Juliano is selling clothing, shoes, and cloth. She has customers all around Takoradi where she delivers her products. With her loan, Julaino hopes to purchase more stock in order to meet her customers' demands.

Juliano is a member of the lending group, Kaesewokan. This group guarantees a loan through a group repayment pledge. Peer pressure and support provide the incentive to repay; if one person in the group defaults, the group members make up the payment amount.

loans.use: To purchase clothes, shoes and cloth

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
Santiago B. works in radio. Nevertheless this job doesn’t provide enough money to pay his family’s expenses so he began to look for a business to be able to have extra income to pay all his household expenses. After thinking about it, he decided to sell candy and groceries taking advantage of the fact that he has a motorbike to deliver his products. Little by little he became known in the neighborhoods and he himself delivers candy to the houses of the people that have parties and other events.

Nevertheless today he doesn’t have a lot of merchandise because of the Christmas season and he needs to restock for other events so therefore he is asking for a loan of US$575 that will be repaid in 6 months and with this money he will be able to buy merchandise and not have his stock be empty. With your help Santiago will be able to keep his family moving forward.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Santiago B. trabaja en la radio. Sin embargo este trabajo no le deja suficiente dinero para poder pagar los gastos de su familia y fue así como comenzó a buscar un negocio para poder obtener ingresos extras para pagar todos los gastos de su casa. Después de pensarlo, se decidió por vender dulces y abarrotes aprovechando que cuenta con una moto que es en la que reparte sus productos. Poco a poco se dio a conocer entre los de sus colonias y el mismo les lleva los dulces a sus casas para las personas que tengan fiestas y otros eventos.

Sin embargo actualmente ya no cuenta con mucha mercancía por la temporada navideña y necesita surtirse para otros eventos que hay por su casa es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $575 que está dispuesto a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero poder comprar mercancía para no tener vacío su repertorio. Con tu ayuda Santiago podrá sacar adelante a su familia.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mat-weaving is one common activity that brings stable income in Quang Xuong town, Thanh Hoa. However, weaving a pretty sedge mat is not easy for every family. Knowing the customers’ need and taste, Mrs. Nguyen Thi L., 43 years old, and her family, focus on weaving attractive mats. Therefore, the materials required need to be sophisticated. When materials are still cheap, she borrows money to buy good materials for mats. Then, she sells them with higher prices to the customers. All of her mats are welcomed and consumed by the customers. As a result, she can raise her 3 children and send them to school. Her family life is also much better. Her current income is 200 USD/ month. This time, she wants to borrow 400 USD to buy more sedge and other materials. She is currently a member of the 14th branch of the Fund.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Làm chiếu là một nghề mang lại thu nhập ổn định và rất phổ biến tại huyện Quảng Xương, Thanh Hóa, nhưng làm chiếu đẹp thì không phải gia đình nào cũng làm được. Nắm bắt được nhu cầu của thị trường, gia đình chị Nguyễn Thị Lâm, 43 tuổi, tập trung làm chiếu đẹp, vì vậy yêu cầu của nguyên liệu cũng cầu kỳ. Khi giá cả đang rẻ chị vay vốn mua nguyên liệu tốt để làm chiếu. Khi gặp khách chị bán lại với giá cao. Chiếu chị dệt ra bao nhiêu tiêu thụ hết bằng ấy. Nhờ vậy chị Lâm có thể nuôi 3 con ăn học tới nơi tới chốn, cuộc sống gia đình cũng đầy đủ. Thu nhập hàng tháng khoảng 200USD, vòng vốn tới chị xin vay thêm 400USD để mua đay, cói làm chiếu. Chị Lâm hiện đang là thành viên của chi nhánh 14.

loans.use: Buy sedge to weave mat

loans.name: Khaitbibi

texts.en: Khaitbibi A. is 45 years old, married and has three children. She works as a farmer, growing crops such as wheat, onion, potatoes, watermelons, maize and tomatoes. She also raises cattle. Her husband (shown in the photo) and two sons help her in this work. Presently, they have a crop of wheat and onions in the ground. Farming has been the family's main source of income for the last four years. Khaitbibi is requesting a loan of $1,000 to buy items such as seeds, fertilizer and fuel. She'll also use part of the loan to pay the salaries of a machine operator and seasonal workers. This is Khaitbibi's second loan, and she promises to repay it with the same accuracy that she showed when repaying her first one.

loans.use: To buy fuel and seeds for potatoes, watermelon and corn, and to pay the salary of a machine operator and seasonal workers.

loans.name: Amina's Raha Group

texts.en:
Amina is 31 years old and is a married woman with 4 children, ages 13, 10, 7 and 4 years old. Amina owns a small food store that she started in 2005. Every day, she works from 8am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing in grocery and food vending.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Parween

texts.en:
I was married 25 years ago and reside with my family in Lahore, a big city in Pakistan. I migrated to this city from a small city, Arifwala, with my husband ten years ago. I have nine children: four daughters and five sons. My eldest son is a public transport driver and the younger to him has a construction supplies business while another son attends school.

My husband paints pedestrian crossings on roads on order. Currently we need a loan to buy a small van to transport our supplies. We will also add to our savings with your loan.

loans.use: Buy a small van

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en:
Faustina E. prepares and sells a native food called ‘Banku’. Maize is used for the preparation of the Banku. It is highly patronized by the natives of her area.

Her husband is a fisherman, but his income is not sufficient to support Faustina and their four children.

She wishes to increase production and sales with a loan.

loans.use: To increase production of a native food, Banku, for resale

loans.name: Hou

texts.en:
Hou Y., is a 51 year old widow who lives with two of her children in the Prey Veng province. She sells groceries in the local market and typically makes $8 (US dollars) per day.

Hou Y. is assisted by her two children: one is a driver and the other works to sell groceries along with her mother.

Hou Y. would like to expand her business, but lacks the ability to transport her goods at a low cost. She would like to purchase a small truck to transport her goods, enabling her to reach more customers in a variety of locations.

Hou Y. is asking for a loan of $1000 (US dollars) to purchase a small truck. She believes this investment can improve her standard of living through an increase in her daily income.

loans.use: Purchase small truck to transport goods

loans.name: Bifotima

texts.en:
K. Bifotima is 52 years old. She is married and the loving mother of four children. For ten years she has had a business selling fabrics in the market. She travels to the neighboring towns, Istaravshan and Khujand, for purchasing the fabrics. It has now become the main source of income for her family as currently her husband is unemployed. The difficult living conditions forced two of her elder sons to go to Russia for jobs.

Bifotima is a cheerful, hard worker despite the difficulties she faces. She has received and repaid five loans from IMON which have helped create stability for her business. She is also raising cattle with the help of her husband. Today Bifotima is requesting a loan of 3400 Somoni ($1000) with the term of 6 months for expanding her business. She is planning to purchase new, modern fabrics and also small cattle. 

Bifotima is counting on your help. Your support will really help her. Be an important part of the growth of Bifotima’s business!

loans.use: Purchasing of fabric and small cattle for expanding the business

loans.name: Amparito Del Socorro

texts.es:
Doña Amparito is requesting a loan to finish constructing a room. She has worked as an elementary school teacher for 17 years. She is a single mother of 2 sons. The oldest is 16, and the baby is 5 months. Despite being a teacher and not having another source of income, Amparito has proven to be a very reponsible, honest, and hard-working woman. She has a great spirit of improving herself professionally. Her dream for the future is to get her master's degree, to have health for her family, and to have a stable career.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Doña Amparito está solicitando su crédito para terminar de construir una habitación. Trabaja como docente de Educación primaria desde hace 17 años, es madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos varones, el mayor de 16 años y un bebe de 5 meses, Amparito a pesar que es una docente asalariada y no depende de otros ingresos ha demostrado ser una mujer muy responsables, honesta y muy trabajadora, tiene gran espíritu de superación profesional y laboral, su sueño para el futuro es estudiar una maestría, salud para su familia y tener estabilidad laboral.

loans.use: To finish constructing a room

loans.name: Comite Kuña Aty Group

texts.es:
El grupo Kuña Aty se inició mediante la acción emprendedora de la actual presidenta quien se interesó por el programa y se propuso a formar su Comité con sus vecinas y conocidas.

El comité se encuentra conformado por mujeres de escasos recursos, la mayoría de ellas viven en un asentamiento denominado San Cayetano de la ciudad de Capiatá.

Son señoras trabajadoras y entusiastas, valoran el préstamo ya le da la posibilidad de contar con buen capital de trabajo y por sobre todo al mismo tiempo fomentar la amistad entre ellas.

Destinan sus créditos a: compra de ropas, frutas y verduras, cosméticos, ingredientes para la cocción de comidas, compra de mercería como; jarras, ollas, repasadores, etc.

El grupo posee de una buena cantidad de ahorro el cual se encuentra depositado en una financiera.

Todas agradecen la oportunidad brindada por la Fundación Paraguaya.

Se destacan por la solidaridad y la unión que reina dentro del Comité Kuña Aty.

Las actividades que desarrollan se detalla a continuación: 1-Brígida B. – Venta de mercería. 2-Selva B. – Venta de ropas. 3-Celia G. – Venta de ropas. 4-Hermogena T. – Venta de comidas. 5-Sonia C.– Venta de ropas. 6-Alfonsa I. – Venta de ropas. 7-Alejandra O. – Venta de comidas. 8-Eugenia O. – Venta de cosméticos. 9-Agueda V. (ausente en la fotografía) – Venta de frutas y verduras. 10-Cheni A. – Venta de comidas. 11-Estela Gómez – Venta de cosméticos. 12-Dora Estela – Venta de frutas. 13-Olga P. – Venta de ropas. 14-Liza Gómez – Venta de mercería. 15-Cristina M. – Venta de frutas.
texts.en:
The group Kuña Aty began through the enterprising action of the woman who today serves as the group’s president, as she became interested in the program and proposed forming a committee with her neighbors and acquaintances. The committee is made up of women of few resources – the majority of them live in a settlement called San Cayetano in the city of Capiatá. They are hardworking and enthusiastic, they value that the loan will give them the possibility of having working capital and above all the strengthen the friendship among them. The loan will be used to: buy clothing, fruit, vegetables, cosmetics, ingredients to make food, pitchers, pots, towels, etc. The group has a good amount of savings which will be deposited in a banking account. They all are thankful for the opportunity provided by the Fundación Paraguaya. They stand out for their solidarity and union that reigns among the Kuña Aty Committee. The work of each member is listed below: 1-Brígida B. - sells merchandise 2-Selva B. – sells clothing 3-Celia G. – sells clothing. 4-Hermogena T. – sells food 5-Sonia C. – sells clothing 6-Alfonsa I. – sells clothing 7-Alejandra O. – sells clothing. 8-Eugenia O. - sells cosmetics 9-Agueda V. (absent from the photo) – sells fruit and vegetables 10-Cheni A. – sells food 11-Estela Gómez – sells cosmetics. 12-Dora Estela – sells fruit 13-Olga P. – sells clothing 14-Liza Gómez - sells merchandise 15-Cristina M. – sells fruit

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothing, fruit, vegetables, cosmetics, ingredients to make food, pitchers, pots, towels, mops, etc.

loans.name: Thoeun

texts.en: Thoeun P., 30, is married and lives about 124 miles from the capital city of Phnom Penh in Cambodia. Living in the province of Kampong Cham, she typically makes about US$1 each day, raising pigs. Her husband has a business of transporting sand and soil by truck to build roads. On average, he makes US$10 each day. This couple has three children, two of whom are students. Thoeun P. would like to take out a loan of US$1000 to breed more pigs.

loans.use: To breed more pigs.

loans.name: Jorge Felix

texts.es: Don Jorge es separado de su esposa hace muchos años, el se hizo cargo de sus hijos, el último esta todavia vivendo con él pero ya es independiente economicamente, su hijo tiene aproximadamente 22 años. Trabaja con taxi desde hace muchos años, por lo que tiene bastante experiencia. También es conocido por algunas empresas de courrier las cuales contratan sus servicios para entrega de paquetes y sobres. La competencio es de media a baja, existe demanda para su servicio. El credito fue para realizar refacciones en su vehículo en general. Es un cliente antiguo de la institucion, sus promedios estan entre 3 dias de retaso aproximadamente pero es un cliente que es fiel a la institución y que solo trabaja con nosotros.
texts.en:
Don Jorge has been separated from his wife for many years, and he has taken care of their children. The youngest still lives with him but is economically independent. His son is 22. Jorge has worked as a taxi driver for many years, so he has a lot of experience. He is known by courier companies, which hire him to deliver packages and envelopes. His competition ranges from medium to low; there is a demand for his services. This credit will go towards making general repairs to his vehicle. He is an old client of our institution. His payments on average are 3 days late, but he is a loyal client of ours and only works with us.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle repairs

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
A "sari-sari" (variety) store is operating in Barangay Balasdiot, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental.  It is owned by Luzminda T. who is 38 years of age and married with one child. Her husband is a fisherman who bravely faces the perils of the sea.  He works hard for the family, but Luzminda also brings support through tending her little store. From a small loan, she has managed it as time passes.  She said, when it comes to running a business she has to be wise.  What she earns for the day will be used for rolling capital tomorrow. That goes on and on until she feels for a bigger loan.  

Being a member of Paglaum MPC, she applied for a PHP 10,000 loan.  She is thankful of the approved amount which will be used for additional canned goods, soft drinks and laundry items.

She hopes to take good care of her business and to be able to send her child to school. For the living she and her husband strive for is for them to taste a good life, she concluded with tears.

loans.use: to invest on soft drinks, canned goods and laundry items

loans.name: Nuri

texts.ru: Орипова Нури женщина в возрасте 51 года , мать троих детей.Все дети уже взрослые.Она с молодости работала продавцом а универмаге.После распада Союза она начала свой бизнес.Нури торгует на рынке мужской одеждой,в основном мужскими рубашками.За товаром она ездит с сыном.Для расширения бизнеса Нури решила получить кредит.
texts.en:
Nuri O. is a woman of 51 years of age and a mother of three children. All her children are grown up. She has been working as a sales person in a supermarket since she was young. After the collapse of the Soviet Union she started her own business. Now Nuri sells men's clothing, mainly men's shirts, on the market. She travels with her son to buy the merchandise. To expand her business Nuri decided to apply for a loan.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Fokaben  (L’ Entente). Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Fokaben est constitué de huit femmes toutes mariées vivant dans des foyers en majorité polygames dans le quartier Hamdallaye de la ville de Koutiala région de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles ont en moyenne 32 ans et 3 enfants. Elles mènent  comme activité principale la vente d’ arachide sous plusieurs formes (grillé ou pâte) et en plus, des condiments. Elles ont de l’expérience dans la transformation de l’arachide et la vente de condiments.
Dans le souci d’augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis bientôt deux ans.  Après avoir correctement remboursé tous les deux premiers prêts qui étaient de 50 000 F CFA et 75 000 F CFA par membre, le groupe Fokaben est à son troixième prêt solidaire de 100 000 F CFA par membre (prêt de groupe).
 Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour achéter des sacs d’arachide et divers condiments alimentaires qui seront  revendus à la  maison, au marché ou de porte en porte. Elles vendent généralement au comptant en détail à une clientèle constituée de femmes.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent réaliser en moyenne 110 000 CFA de bénéfice chacune au cours de ce cycle. Ce bénéfice sera utilisé pour rembourser les intérêts du prêt et faire face aux charges courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The Fokaben group is made up of eight women, all married and living in mostly polygamous households in the Hamdallaye district of the town of Koutiala, Sikasso region (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They have an average age of 32 and on average, 3 children. Their principal business is selling peanuts in various forms (roasted or as peanut butter) and also condiments.
